loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Talin with her son. Anahit's husband is a migrant worker in a neighboring country; he is working hard to sustain his family's living. 

Anahit's elder son Razmik studies at a university in Yerevan town. It is really difficult for Anahit and her husband save money for living costs and at the same time cover university tuition. 

That's the reason Anahit asks Kiva lenders to help her with Razmik's educational costs. She hopes for their support.

loans.use: to pay for her son Razmik's university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad, age 30, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals

loans.name: Phibi

texts.en:
Phibi is a 44-year-old lady from the western part of Kenya in Kisumu county. She supports 3 people in her family and is married. She has 3 children of 6 years old, 3 years old and 3 months old.

Phibi has a tailoring shop, and has had this business for the last 10 years. She comfortably earns a monthly income of KES 18,000. She is now servicing her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to pay for school fees for her first child who has just started school. 

Phibi will use the anticipated profits from her tailoring business to plough back into the business. Her dream is to see her business expand so that she can open another shop and then be able to educate all her children comfortably.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Saye

texts.fr:
Saye est une jeune femme de 27 ans qui évolue dans le commerce de divers produits alimentaires. Une activité qu’il a démarrée il y a de cela 5 ans. Elle a épargné pendant un certain temps avant de pouvoir mettre en place son commerce.
Saye est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’ainé est âgée de 14 ans et le benjamin, de 4 ans. Elle n’a pas de charges et est entretenue elle et ses enfants par son époux.
Saye emprunte cette somme afin d’acheter de l’huile de palme : 3 bidons de 20 litres et 5 kilogrammes de« nététou », (qui est un produit très prisé par les Sénégalais et qui s’accompagne avec le riz au poisson). Saye veut devenir autonome un jour et ne plus avoir recours aux crédits.
texts.en:
Saye is a 27-year old woman who has been building up a business selling a variety of food products. She began this business over five years ago and had saved for some time beforehand so she could set it up. 

Saye is married and mother to four children, the eldest of whom is 14 years old and the youngest four. She does not have any expenses, and she and her children are kept by her husband. 

She is borrowing this amount so that she can buy three 20-liter containers of palm oil and five kilos of "nététou" (a product which is very much appreciated by the Senegalese and serves as a side dish with rice to fish). 

Saye would like to become autonomous one day and not have to resort to loans.

loans.use: to buy palm oil for reselling.

loans.name: Fashamwenewanyu Group

texts.fr:
Gervais  fait partie du groupe Fashamwenewanyu et  habite à  Gitega. Il a  40 ans et est marié  à Rosette, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  tous  étudient.

Il fait le commerce de  la bière locale depuis 10 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bière locale  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Gervais belongs to the Fashamwenewanyu group and lives in Gitega. He is 40 years old and married to Rosette, who is a farmer. They have four children who are all at school.

He has been buying and selling local beer for the past ten years, and this is his first loan from Turame. He is going to increase his capital with the Kiva loan he is granted and buy a large quantity of local beer to resell, so that he can make more money.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of local beer to resell so he can make more money.

loans.name: Mouhamadou Lamine

texts.fr:
Mouhamadou Lamine, 40 ans, est un maçon de profession. Il n’a suivi que des études coraniques et a très tôt approché son père (en1982) qui était maçon et qui lui a appris le métier. Quinze ans après en 1997, son père décédé, il prend la relève. Depuis lors, il travaille avec ses propres moyens.
Mouhamadou Lamine est marié à deux femmes et a neuf enfants dont l’ainé, 18 ans fait la 3e secondaire.
Mouhamadou Lamine vient pour la 1ère fois solliciter un crédit, afin d’augmenter son bois de coffrage. Avec la somme demandée, il pourra acquérir 2 mètres cube de bois. Il loue la moitié et travaille avec l’autre dans ses chantiers.
Mouhamadou Lamine a comme ambition d’élever sa maison, et de la mettre en location, entamer la construction d’autres terrains mais aussi ouvrir une quincaillerie dans la maison et se fournir le matériel dont il aura besoin dans ses chantiers lui-même.
texts.en:
Mouhamadou Lamine, who is 40 years old, is a builder by trade. He completed only Koranic studies and at an early age (in 1982) started working with his father who was also a builder and taught him the trade. Fifteen years later, in 1997, his father died, and he took over the business. Since then he has been working with his own resources. He is married to two women and has nine children, the eldest of whom is 18 years old and in the third grade of secondary school.

Mouhamadou Lamine has just requested a first loan so that he can increase his stock of wood for making wooden frameworks. With the amount he has requested he can get two cubic meters of wood. He rents out half and works with the other half on his building sites.

His ambition is to build his own house and to rent it out; he would also like to build on other pieces of land and open a hardware store in his house so he can supply his own materials for his building sites.

loans.use: to buy wood (for frameworks) to rent out and create wooden frameworks on his building sites.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is 46 years old. He is married and has three children aged 17, 13, and 8 years old. All his chidren are currently attending school. 

Edson operates his own Zoona mobile money transfer business. The business provides affordable and accessable financial services to people in Lusaka, the capital city of Zambia.

Edson works very hard to support his family. He currently has a full-time job and juggles his time between his job and his mobile money transfer business. He has been operating the business for three months. Edson says his community benefits from the business because it is cheap and user friendly, and everyone can access it. He enjoys running the business because it gives him a chance to interact with other small business owners.

Now he is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase a new booth. The booth will be used to service his customers in need of sending or receiving money.  

This is Edson’s first loan and he is looking forward to the opportunity it will provide him to grow the business. He is confident that through hard work he will grow his business and make life much better for him and his family.

loans.use: To purchase a trading booth which he will use to serve his customers

loans.name: Brayan

texts.es: Brayan , un hombre emprendedor , tiene 18  años de edad  y vive  con los padres y un hermano  actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Brayan is an 18 year old entrepreneur. He lives with his parents and a brother. He is requesting a loan with the desire to purchase supplies like fertilizers and fumigators. He wants to help his coffee crop to keep them in good condition during their development, so he can obtain a good quality product. The only limiting factor is  a lack of money.He has to continue growing his business since he depends on it to get ahead. He did a credit application and this is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not registered for other loans at state banks but FUDECOSUR offered a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: purchase farming supplies.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo, tiene la edad de 62  años, está casado y vive con su esposa actualmente. El quiere comprar  almacigo para la resiembra de su cafetal y también algunos insumos. El cuenta con el terreno y lo que quiere es resembrar las zonas más dañadas para así aumentar la cosecha próxima y crecer como un caficultor de la zona. El pretende con estas mejoras generar mayor producción de café y así también le genere ganancias para seguir adelante con su proyecto y mejorar su bienestar Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 62 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife.  

He wants to buy seedlings to re-plant his coffee field, as well as some supplies.  He has the land, and what he would like is to resow the areas that are most damaged in order to increase his next harvest and grow as a coffee producer in the area.  With these improvements he plans to produce a greater amount of coffee and thus also generate earnings to keep moving ahead with his project and improve his well-being.  

This is the first loan he has received from Fudecosur.  He hasn’t had any previous loans through government banks, but Fudecosur has granted a loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies such as manure and herbicides

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 32-year-old refugee. He is married and has two daughters. His wife is a housekeeper and the family lives in an IDP settlement. Hasan earns money by raising and selling seasonal vegetables. He has been working in this field for eight years and his monthly income is 140 AZN.

There is a high demand for fresh vegetables. People buy vegetables and use them to cook delicious national dishes such as badimjhan dolmasi, dovgha, doghramajh, etc. 

Hasan doesn’t earn enough money to cover the demand. He applied for 700 AZN in order to buy good fertilizers and increase his harvest. He wants to provide his family a good life.

loans.use: to buy good fertilizers and increase his vegetable harvest

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 21-year-old single man who opened  an entertainment shop a year ago to earn his living. His work is going on just fine since such a business is highly requested in his region so that teenagers can come and spend their time in a healthy environment, far from damaging their pure minds with political and useless issues that might attract them to an unknown  future.

Omar provides several entertainment services such as internet services, games, Playstation, cards and billiards. Thus, he has to keep his business developing and capable of covering almost all of his customers' needs. For this reason, he is acquiring  a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy additional billiard tables necessary to develop his business and to attract more customers.

He hopes that through future acquired loans, he will be capable of expanding his work services, and he might probably move to a more spacious place.

loans.use: To buy additional billiard tables to attract more customers

loans.name: Ntalasha

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Ntalasha. He describes himself as a happy family man. He is married and has two young children; a four-year-old girl and a two-month-old baby boy. Ntalasha operates a mobile money transfer business.  

Ntalasha started running his business in 2012. Since the time he began, he has now managed to open three additional outlets, the most recent being in a busy township called Chilenje, located in the capital city of Zambia, Lusaka. He describes his business as a technology platform that allows people in Zambia to send and receive money quickly and safely. 

Ntalasha has a vision to open more mobile money transfer shops throughout the country. He is taking out a Kiva loan so that he can increase his working capital at his new Chilenje shop and pay for the trading booth. This will help Ntalasha to serve more customers and make more profits. The profits help him take care of his growing family. 

Ntalasha would like to take this opportunity to thank Kiva lenders. He says his standard of living has drastically improved due to the growth experienced in his business over the past two years. He attributes the growth in his business to the loans he has received from Kiva. This is Ntalasha’s fourth Kiva loan. He has successfully repaid all his previous loans.

loans.use: To purchase a trading booth and increase the money he uses to provide services to customers at his shop

loans.name: Katerin

texts.es: Katerin, tiene la edad 22 de  años, está casada y vive con el esposo y un hijo. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de unos pollos y el concentrado para el engorde de los mismos. Ella cuenta con varios pollos  a su poder y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. Ella quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de la familia  y crecer con le proyecto de cría de pollos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Katerin is 22 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and child.  

She plans to buy some chickens and feed concentrate to fatten them with this loan.  She has a number of chickens and her plan is to feed them with concentrate in order to fatten them more quickly.  She wants her animals to be at the ideal weight to later sell them in her town market, or in neighboring towns.  She wants to maximize her earnings for her own well-being and that of her family.  She also wants to expand her business raising chickens.  

This is the first loan that she has received from Fudecosur.  She hasn’t had any previous loans through government banks, but Fudecosur has granted a loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy chickens and concentrated feed

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 36 years old and married. They have three children. He has been in the transport business for one year now. He would like a loan of KES. 20,000 through which he will purchase stock of cereal like maize and beans for selling in the community.

He currently makes a monthly income of KES. 1,200. This is his first loan. Through this loan he will expand his business and he anticipates that from the profits, he will educate his children. He hopes and dreams of one day buying his own land.

loans.use: to  purchase stock of cereals like maize and beans for selling in the community.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 49 years old and married. They have been blessed with four children. She has been in retail business for seven years. 

Currently, she makes a monthly income of KES 8,500. She would like a loan of KES 15,000 to purchase more stock like wheat flour, tea leaves, rice, and cooking oil for her general store. This is her second loan term and she successfully repaid her previous loan.

She anticipates that through the profits she she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to buy a plot and build her family home.

loans.use: to puchase stock like wheat flour, tea leaves, rice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 43 years old. She is married and together with her spouse has been blessed with four children who are all studying. She has been  in the farming business for eight years.

Currently, she makes an monthly income of KES 7,500 and would like a loan of KES 15,000. She has successfuly repaid all her previous loans. Through this loan, she would like to expand her business by purchasing seedlings and fertilizer. 

She anticipates that through the profits, she will pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for business expansion

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame AWA née en  Aout 1956 à TOUGAN,  mère de 5 enfants, elle réside chez son défunt  époux dans une famille traditionnelle à NIMBOUGOU un village de l’arrondissement de LOULOUNI dans la région de Sikasso 3ième region administrative de la république du MALI. 
Madame AWA  mène des activités d’achat et de vente des friperies il y'a 6 ans, elle s’approvisionne à SIKASSO, à BAMAKO et à BOBO (BURKINA-FASO).
A fin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso un septième prêt individuel. Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 2 balles de friperies pour la revendre au détail sur place et à NIMBOUGOU à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.  
EIle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Ms. AWA, born in August 1956 in TOUGAN, is the mother of five children. She resides in her deceased husband’s house in a traditional family in NIMBOUGOU, a village in the LOULOUNI district, in Région de Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Ms. AWA has been buying and selling used clothing for six years. She gets her supplies in SIKASSO, BAMAKO, and BOBO (BURKINA-FASO).

To meet the needs of her customer base, which is growing more and more, she is requesting a seventh individual loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This loan will enable her to purchase 2 bales of secondhand clothing to resell to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit locally and in NIMBOUGOU. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 42,000 francs CFA per month. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan with interest, and the rest will go toward her savings.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing

loans.name: Nazaket

texts.en:
Nazaket is a 41-year-old woman. She is married and has four sons. The main source of the family’s income is gardening. She has a small garden and raises there seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them at a local bazaar. She has been working in this field for nine years and her monthly income is 150 AZN. Nazaket’s husband is a farmer and he helps her in this business.

Gardening is very popular in Azerbaijan because fruits and vegetables are in high demand. People buy them every day and for holidays. They prefer to buy from private gardens because products there are always fresh and tasty.

Nazaket has a big family and her income doesn’t cover demands. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan in order to buy high quality garden tools and fertilizer. This will increase her garden’s yield and her family’s income. She plans to build a big garden and greenhouse for fruit trees and vegetables in the future.

loans.use: o buy high quality garden tools

loans.name: Asly

texts.es: Asly, tiene la edad 24 de  años, está casada y vive con el esposo. Ella  pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de unos cerdos y el concentrado para el engorde de los mismos. Ella no  cuenta con  cerdos y quiere iniciar con este proyecto y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. Ella quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella  quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancia  y crecer con el proyecto de cerdos de engorde. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en: Asly is 24 years old. She is married lives with her husband. With the loan, she intends to buy some pigs and concentrate to fatten them up. She doesn't have pigs now and wants to start this project. She intends to feed them concentrate to fatten them up quicker. She wants to have her animals at the ideal weight so she can then sell them in the local market or in nearby areas. She wants to generate the biggest profit she can and grow with the pig fattening project. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any other loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with more ease of payment and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrate.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is from Qarinj village. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law and two children. Karine and her husband teach at the local village school. They also have been involved in agriculture for 15 years. The livestock that they keep includes cows, pigs, chickens and some calves. 

Karine has now applied for this loan of USD 600 to be able to purchase forage and feed her livestock. Because of some financial difficulties the family is unable to purchase a plot of land and start growing grass. That's the reason why this loan is their only help for feeding the livestock.

As this is Karine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Roy

texts.es: Roy, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 37 años de edad  y vive con la esposa y cuatro hijos   actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, herbicidas y fumigaciones , el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer    préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Roy is an enterprising man. He is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and four children. Now he has asked for a loan in order to buy materials such as fertilizer, herbicide and sprays. He wants to help his coffee crops in order to keep them in good conditions during their growth, so he can obtain a good quality product. The only limitation this gentleman has is a lack of money to keep growing, because this activity depends on that to get ahead. That is why he is asking for a loan and this is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has no other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR  has offered him the loan with more ease of payment and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and sprays.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a 44-year-old married man. He has two children. He operates a retail business selling clothes. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are good. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low capital. 

Titus will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: In God Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called In God and are made up of four women who live in the same neighborhood. 

The group representative, Rebecca (the woman standing on the left in the photo), is 34 years old. Rebecca received an education up to the primary school level. Rebecca is married to a man named Christian whom she lives with. The couple has one dependent child. Together, the couple meet the costs for their household expenses. 

In order to meet these expenses, Rebecca sells various skirts, tops and straight dresses through hawking. She has done this for the last six years. Rebecca gets her supplies from a market in Ghana. In order to further strengthen their buying power and better satisfy client demand, Rebecca and the other members of the In God Group are requesting their third loan from ID-Ghana. Their previous loans were repaid in full.

loans.use: To sell skirts, tops, and straight dresses through hawking to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, peppers, salt, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Abdulrazak

texts.en:
This is 22-year-old Abdulrazak. He is a single man, living with his family in Haja, Yemen. Abdulrazak studied in elementary school, but he couldn't finish his study because of the hard conditions in his family. He didn't surrender to the miserable condition of his family. For this reason, he decided to begin his own business. 

Abdularazak started his own business many years ago. With support from his father, Abdulrazak opened a laundry in Haja city and began his business because he realized that it would be profitable due to a new settlement area. His business is located in a good area of town and his main customers are the public. He works seven days a week and twelve hours a day and gets support every month. 

Recently, Abdulrazak rented a power generator which costs him a lot of money; therefore, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER  from AMB to buy his own power generator for his laundry in order to assist him in save a lot of money instead of the rented power generator. 

In the future, Abdulrazak plans to get a automatic laundry and opens anther branches in the city.

loans.use: To buy his own power generator for his laundry

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 39 years old, a single mother who has been blessed with one child. She has been a farmer for five years. She has also successfully repaid her previous loan and this is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya.

Currently Racheal makes a monthly income of KES.7,200 and would like a loan of KES.10,000 which she will use to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm. 

Racheal anticipates that through her profits she will be able to pay school fees for her child. In future, she hopes that she will be able to educate her child to higher levels, even University.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings for planting and fertilizer

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old single man, the sole breadwinner for five members of his family. Ali quit school during his intermediate level in order to start working in a gas station, where he was responsible for washing cars and changing oil, in order to be capable of supporting his beloved family members and covering their necessary expenses.

Two years ago, Ali took an important step forward, through establishing his own business, a shop that deals with washing cars, changing oil and selling special car accessories. At the beginning, he faced problems with diversifying the requested products and buying the necessary expensive business tools. 

Today, Ali is well-known in his region with the special services he provides, in addition to the encouraging prices he sets.

To keep his business up-to-date, Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with newly released car accessories, in addition to doing necessary maintenance on the cement work in his shop.

As for the future, Ali is working hard to make his dream of opening his own gas station come true.

loans.use: To buy newly released car accessories for resale and do necessary maintenance on the cement work in his shop

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en:
Tracy  is a single mother of three children, two of whom go to school. 

She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and ever increasing prices of used clothes. 

She aspires to sell on a wholesale basis  only and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses  includes  school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: María Elsy

texts.es: María es una mujer soñadora, emprendedora y luchadora que nunca le ha gustado verse como una empleada, siempre optó por ser independiente, de tener su propio negocio y generar sus propios ingresos. Actualmente tiene una hija estudiando en la universidad y es ella la motivación por la cual se inspira cada día, es una madre orgullosa que tiene un único sueño y es ver a su hija convertida en toda una profesional. María es la dueña de un local de miscelánea en la cual vende diferentes tipos de productos desde abarrotes, verduras, productos farmacológicos y de aseo personal, pero la determinación y ambición de esta mujer no termina ya que quiere adquirir un enfriador, surtirlo con carnes frías para darles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos y encontrar en su tienda  todo tipo de artículos que requieran para el hogar y es muy necesario pues los grandes mercados quedan retirados del sector residencial donde labora María,  es una ayuda no solo para María si no para los habitantes de la zona que pueden tener una  amplia gama de productos a su alcance, poder ser reconocida no solo por su sonrisa a la hora de atender un cliente si no por una persona que con un propósito logro satisfacer una necesidad propia y la de muchos habitantes de su zona.
texts.en: María is a dreamer, entrepreneur, and a fighter. She has never liked to see herself as an employee and always opted for independence, having her own business and generating her own income. At this time, she has a daughter who i sin college and that is what inspires her every day. She is a proud mother whose only dream is to see her daughter graduate and have a career. María is the owner of a general store where she sells different products such as groceries, vegetables, pharmaceuticals and personal hygiene items. But this woman's determination and ambition don't stop there and she wants to acquire a cooler and stock it with cold cuts to give her customers a wider variety of products so they can find all types of items in her store that they need for their homes. It is very necessary because the big markets are at a distance from the residential area where Maria works. It is a help not only for María but for the area residents so they can have a wide variety of products at their reach. She can be known not only for her smile when she serves her customers but as a person who had a goal and was able to fulfill her own needs and that of many area residents.

loans.use: to acquire a cooler and stock up on cold cuts.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma lives with her mother and older brother.  She sells products to her friends.  She began working as a saleswoman two years ago and has become sales director.  She orders products to sell and coaches sales representatives.  She makes sales herself and is also increasing the number of salespeople working for her.  

With the loan, she will increase the number of products she has in order to earn more.  She wants to continue as sales director for many years.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Fatma Hanım,annesi ve abisi ile yaşıyor.  Network'ün ürünlerini satıyor.  İki yıl önce  satış elemanı olarak çalışmış.  Ürünlerin sipariş vererek satışlarını gerçekleştiriyor.  Satış temsilcilerini yetiştiriyor.  Hem satış yapıyor hem de elemanlarını çoğaltıyor.  İki yılda satış direktörü olmuş.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile ürünlerini çoğaltarak para kazanmak istiyor.  Satiş direktörlüğünü uzun yıllar sürdürmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose  is married with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). 

She has a business of selling tomatoes and has been in this business for nine months. She has applied for loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and perishability. 

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to start growing tomatoes. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouma est un regroupement de femmes de Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, des Condiments, Produits cosmétiques, Tissus, File, Boisson et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur dix-neuvième prêt de groupe. 
Mamou est un membre du groupe Sabougnouma  assise au bout et à  gauche, qui est vendeuse de Condiments et de boisson non alcoolisées (jus d’orange, bisap, tamarin, zaban).  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des fruits qu’elle transforme en boisson au fur et à mesure qu’elle les vend à la maison à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure de ces condiments au grand marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Sabougnouma comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Mamou compte réaliser  105 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma is a Hamdallaye group of women in the city of Koutiala. They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. The women average 43 years of age and have at least four children. This group of women does commerce in various goods, such as condiments, cosmetic products, cloth, thread, beverages, and general goods. To increase the size of their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are now on their 19th group loan. 

Mamou, a member of the group Sabougnouma, is the one sitting at the end on the left. She is a vendor of condiments and soft drinks, such as orange juice, bissap [made from dried hibiscus flowers], tamarind, or zaban [made from a vine fruit], and she intends to use her loan to purchase fruit that she processes into drinks over time, so as to sell them to a diverse customer base at her house. She procures these condiments at the big market. 

While the other members of the group Sabougnouma plan on making an average profit  of 100,000 francs CFA each over the course of the cycle, Ms. Mamou plans on making 105,000 francs. In addition to paying back the loans, the women use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital. They would like to see this Soro Yiriwaso partnership bolstered, so that inventory shortages are rare.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for making juice drinks

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with six children, four of whom go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her granddaughters). She has a mini bakery   and has been in this business for 20 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baking flour, cooking oil and charcoal. She generates additional income from rental houses. 

Betty works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of cooking oil and wheat flour. She is aspiring of owning a big bakery and also educating her school-going children up to university. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more baking flour, cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos nació en la comunidad de Huarancca el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo al sur de la ciudad del Cusco, él tiene 60 años de edad  y es una persona responsable que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras productos, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, él agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo  y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Santos was born in the community of Huarancca, which is in the District of Colquepata in Paucartambo Province. This area is located south of the city of Cusco. He is 60 years old and a responsible person who earns his living by farming and raising livestock. Santos has several plots of land where he grows potatoes, barley, wheat, beans, and other crops.

He is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy seeds. Santos is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan, so he promises to handle his payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (young brother). 

She has a business of a food stall and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of bread, biscuits, cooking oil, chapatti, samosas and donuts. 

She works in a shop and works five days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of bread, biscuits, cooking oil, chapatti, samosas and donuts.

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en:
Janeffer  is married with five children and one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). 

She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for one month. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season which prevents her customers from reaching her. 

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Fortunate

texts.en:
Fortunate is a hardworking lady, aged 45, from Kakoba,  a suburb in Mbarara municipality. She dropped out of school to help her mother in farming. 

Due to the fact that she was bright, she also learnt tailoring and ended up starting her own workshop. She later got a loan of 1000,000 from Ugafode Microfinance which helped her business to grow further and this loan was repaid very well. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 to complete her house to accommodate her mother.

loans.use: To finish house construction

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 27 years old, married, and together with his spouse has two children who are both in school. His wife supports him in his farming. He has been in the motorcycle transport for 2 years. 

He currently makes a monthly income of KES 8,500. He would like a loan of KE .20,000 for business utilization through which he would purchase beans for trading. This is his first loan term. He anticipates that from his profits he will be able to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

In the future he hopes that he will be able to buy his own plot to build his family a homestead.

loans.use: to purchase beans for planting and trading

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, 42 years old, is a permanent resident of Rwampara, a surburb in Mbarara District. He is married with eight children and two dependents from his brother who died three years ago. All his children and dependents are in school. 

He was a police officer but retired early because he was injured in an accident. After his retirement, he resorted to banana planting. This made him prosper in life and he even managed to build a semi-permanent house to accommodate his family.  He is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 UGX to buy manure for his banana plantation.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Yagub

texts.en:
Yagub was born in 1971. He has been married for 17 years and has two children. Both of Yagub’s children are going to secondary school. His wife is a seller in a local market. The family is living in the Fuzuli region, but they have already been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city for 20 years. 

Yagub repairs cars’ tires. He has been in this profession for 13 years. A while ago, one of his apparatus was broken. For repair of the damaged apparatus, Yagub needs a loan in the amount of 1,200 Azerbaijan New Manat. For this help, he says a great thank you to the Kiva organization.

loans.use: to repair damaged apparatus for his tire repair business.

loans.name: Pedro Raul

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de tapices y mantos, el socio vende diferentes mantos,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socioa es ampliar el negocio de venta de tapices y mantos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tapices y mantos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in his store selling tapestries and blankets. He sells various blankets, working from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  He has had his business for 8 years now, and it is going very well. His dream is to expand his business selling tapestries and blankets, and he has requested a loan in order to purchase them.

The member is happy for the loan, and he promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase tapestries and blankets.

loans.name: Rosio

texts.es: Rosio vive en La Paz y se dedica a cuidar niños para ganar dinero.  Rosio necesita credito para pagar servicios de odontologia, ya que ella tuvo un accidente y perdio los dientes frontales, por lo que necesita implantes dentales
texts.en: Rosio lives in La Paz.  She takes care of children in order to earn money.  Rosio needs the loan to pay for dental services.  She had an accident and lost her front teeth.  Therefore, she needs dental implants.

loans.use: to pay for dental services

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités, condiments, de la pomme de terre, de chaussures plastiques de produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ami (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20pièces de pagnes wax en gros au grand marché  .La revente se fait en détails à Djalakorodji et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Ami espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Sabougnouma is composed of married women living with their husbands and children in traditional families. The women average 44 years of age and five children each, all living in Djalakorodji, a districct in Bamako. They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. The group members work in the small-scale commerce of clothing (the best quality Wax ’pagnes’, the colorful cloth of western Africa), condiments, potatoes, plastic shoes, and cosmetics products.  

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth solidarity loan cycle.  

Ms. Ami (the woman standing at the far left in the photo) is know for selling clothing (Wax ‘pagne’) of the best quality. She intends to use her loan to purchase 20 pieces of Wax ’pagnes’ in bulk at the big market. Her sales are made retail to a customer base mostly of women in Djalakorodji and by going door to door. 

With this loan, Ms. Ami hopes to make an average monthly profit  of 55,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in her business and to meet the sundry needs of the children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food stuffs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 6 years and 9 years. She describes herself to be good. Jane operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes for sale. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a busy and strategic place and her primary customers are good. Jane describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will  improve her standard of living. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials to build a business premises

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel, a father of four, is an inspirational mixed farmer from the North Rift region of Kenya. He earns a living through selling of milk, providing transport services, selling crop produce and venturing into short-term businesses. His hobby is milking and feeding his dear cow he named 'Mrembo' (Swahili word for Beautiful). Daniel joined Juhudi Kilimo after witnessing tremendous growth of his neighbours who were existing members. Before he joined Juhudi, Daniel thought only successful business people could be granted loans due to their standing in society and consistent cash flow. He is seeking funds to introduce poultry farming to engage his wife in agribusiness too. From poultry, he is also going to get more eggs for his family's consumption and increased income through sales.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 46-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be good. She operates a M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone-based  money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are reliable. 

Grace describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add M-pesa float, i.e., money for customers to withdraw. She hopes that in the future, she will have an improved business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float, i.e., money for customers to withdraw.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a single man. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells bread. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a fast-growing area, and his primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of bread. His business goal is to own rental houses within five years.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread

loans.name: Rubaga Abesiga Mukan Group

texts.en: Mary, thanks the Kiva lenders for contributing towards her previous loan. Mary was actually able to move from the roadside to a market area and this has increased the quality of her customers and sales in the long run. She is hard working and encourages women to indulge in income generating activities to support their households.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Octavio

texts.en:
Octavio is an aspiring entrepreneur and this is his story.

Octavio is 40 years old, married and has two children. He has been an employee for five years now at a company that prints designs on wafers, as a designer for cakes and gelatins.

At his work he receives orders from clients who want this type of dessert with an occasion or special design. Octavio considers himself now as having the expertise and know-how of the business and plans to open his own company in this same sector; this is why he has asked for this loan, as seed capital for his new venture.

loans.use: to open up his new dessert design business

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es: Policarpio es casado y tiene dos hijos, Policarpio se dedica al transporte y vive en El Alto Policarpio necesita dinero para pagar el mantenimiento de su vehiculo Policarpio mantiene a su familia puesto que la esposa se dedica a cuidar el hogar
texts.en: Policarpio is married and has two children.  Policario works in transportation, and he lives in El Alto.  Policarpio needs money to pay for the maintenance on his vehicle.  Policarpio supports his family given that his wife devotes herself to caring for the household.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories, top-up cards, etc.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Âgé de 26 ans, cet emprunteur s’appelle Modou et il s’active dans le commerce. Il a été embauché comme vendeur dans une entreprise de fabrication de lait caillé depuis seulement un an. Il travaille entre 7h et midi en livrant du lait caillé en sachets dans des boutiques abonnées.  Modou fait parallèlement de l’élevage à petites échelles, activité qu’il envisage de développer dans le futur.
Modou est célibataire et habite avec sa sœur où il ne dépense pratiquement rien puisse que c’est elle qui s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne.
Le crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra de compléter pour les frais liés à la construction de sa maison. Modou pense à développer son élevage à grande échelle et à diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur, Modou, is 26 years old and active in commerce. He has been employed as a vendor in an enterprise producing curdled milk for only a year. He works from 7 AM to noon delivering curdled milk in bags to member shops. He also raises livestock on a small scale. It is a business he envisions developing in the future. 

Modou is unmarried and lives with his sister where he has practically no expenses, since his sister takes care of day-to-day expenses. This loan he is requesting will enable him to cover the costs associated with building a house. Modou is thinking of scaling up his livestock farming and diversifying his work.

loans.use: to finish building his house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay his children's school/college fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seafood, peanut butter, and more to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school/college fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice and other local food stuffs to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Francisca se sigue dedicando al trabajo como terapeuta fisica,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda atender a sus clientes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un artefacto un televisor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Francisca continues working as a physical therapist.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She has been in this business for five years.  It is going very well for her.  Francisca’s dream is to have a place where she can tend to her clients.

She is requesting the loan to buy a television.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Janes

texts.en: Janes is a 28-year-old married man. He has two children. Janes describes himself as disciplined. He operates a business where he makes motor vehicle body panels. His primary customers are car owners. His biggest business challenge is a lack of materials. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a gas welding cylinder. His business goal is to have his own garage within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be able to start another business for his spouse. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a gas welding cylinder

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a single mother of two children, both of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. 

Joan has a restaurant and has been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, sweet potatoes and fresh beans. She generates additional income by selling soft drinks. She works from home and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

She aspires to have a fully stocked restaurant and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO to acquire more capital. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more green bananas, beef, rice, sweet potatoes and fresh beans.

loans.name: Khaterine Geraldine

texts.es:
La socia Khaterine Geraldine se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negoco de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Khaterine Geraldine is still working at her grocery store. She sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk and crackers. She works from 6:00 a.m to 10:00 p.m. She has already been in this business for five years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. 

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and crackers. She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and crackers

loans.name: Nuevo Camino 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en: Benita is the coordinator of this group, Nuevo Camino 1, 2 & 3. She is the single mother of three children who live together in a simple home in the rural area surrounding San Pedro de Macoris. Their home is surrounded by sugarcane fields. Benita has had her business for around five years, and started it with her own savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, which is a fried-food stall where she sells chicken, plantains, empanadas, and many other items. Before she started doing this business she worked in many different places. Benita is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and successfully used them to grow her business. In the future, she will save her profits to reinvest in her inventory and also to improve her business. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, chicken, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Emma Carola

texts.es:
La socia Emma Carola se siguen dedicando  al negocio de venta de joyas y adornos de plata,la socia vende aretes,collares y pulseras, la socia vende diferentes joyas y adornos de plata, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de joyas y adornos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar joyas y adornos de plata.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Emma Carola still works at her business selling jewelry and silver items. She sells earrings, necklaces and bracelets. She sells different jewelry and silver adornments. She works from 8:00 a.m to 7:00 p.m. She has been working in this business for eight years and it is going very well for her. 

Her dream is to expand the business selling jewelry and silver merchandise. She is requesting the loan to buy jewelry and silver decorations. She is happy about the loan and committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and silver decorations

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 46 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Leonora is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

Leonora has been raising livestock for 15 years, and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Deysi De Jesús

texts.es:
Deysi de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta 6º grado, esta acompañada, su pareja es empleado en una  venta de verduras, tienen una niña de un año y cuatro meses.  El negocio donde esta empleado actualmente es la venta de verduras el cual tiene 4 años de ejercer ese trabajo, el negocio esta ubicado en la terminal de oriente, del mercadito de la ciudad, se decidió por ese trabajo porque se le hacia mas cerca para llegar, tenia un empleo antes de este, el cual era la venta de ropa, la distancia de su empleo actual es de 20 minutos viajando en bus publico y su horario es de 5:00 am a 6:00 pm. Deysi por su parte se dedica a realizar los oficios domesticos en su casa.

 El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar los materiales de su casa como lo son: bloques, láminas, arena, hierro, cemento con lo cual construirá una parte de las paredes con bloque y el resto con láminas. Actualmente vive en la casa de su mamá, donde no tiene la suficiente privacidad como lo tuviera en su propia casa y de esa forma no tuvieran que compartir su hogar con otros familiares. Los sueños de esta familia es lograr  ampliar su casa para que cuando su hija crezca, pueda tener su propia habitación y de esa manera puedan tener mas seguridad.
texts.en:
Deysi, age 22, went to school through the sixth grade.  She is in a relationship, and her life partner is employed by a vegetable sales business.  They have a daughter who is one year and four months old.  

The business where he is currently employed sells vegetables.  He has had this job for four years.  The business is located at the east terminal at the city market.  He decided on this work because it is closer to get to.  Before this he had a job selling clothes.  Getting to his current job is a 20 minute ride on a public bus.  His schedule is from 5:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  Deysi devotes herself to the household chores.

She will use the loan to buy construction materials like cement blocks, zinc sheets, sand, iron and cement.  These materials will be used to build part of the walls with cement blocks and the rest with zinc sheets.  She currently lives in her mother’s house, where she does not have the same amount of privacy as she would if she had her own house.  This way they will not have to share their household with other families.

This family’s dream is to manage to expand their house so that when their daughter grows she will be able to have her own room.  This way they will be able to have more security.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement blocks, zinc sheets, sand, iron and cement.

loans.name: Jose Atilio

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y un hijo, se dedica a vender diferentes productos de primera necesidad de manera ambulante en su vehículo, esté actividad la aprendió como empleado en tiendas. El riesgo que representa es la vulnerabilidad ente la delincuencia. No tiene ayuda económica del extranjero.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra jabón, detergente, lejía, granos básicos, azúcar, sal, bebidas, boquitas, entre otros productos, espera sacar el mejor provecho de la inversión y brindar a su familia un estilo de vida más digno.
 Su sueño es ser un distribuidor mayoritario de productos de primera necesidad y ubicar el negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and one child. He makes a living selling different convenience store products on the street from his vehicle. He learned how to do this work as an employee in stores. The risk it poses is his vulnerability to delinquency. He has no financial help from abroad.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of soap, detergent, bleach, basic grains, sugar, salt, soda, snacks, and other products. He hopes to make the most of the investment and offer his family a more dignified way of life. 

His dream is to be a wholesale convenience store product distributor and run his business from his house.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergent, bleach, basic grains, sugar, salt, soda, snacks, and other products

loans.name: Helengen

texts.en:
Helengen is single and has a raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Helengen requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feeds, and other supplies for her business.

Helengen has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Helengen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feeds, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie is a married woman with three children and a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 34 years old and has two children who are currently in school. She runs a fish-vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan from NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Marjorie has been in this business for four years, and her goal for the future is to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Isidory

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Isidory works hard to support her family.

She has a sewing business in the Philippines, and also earns income by selling Avon products.  Isidory seeks to borrow PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her sewing business.

Isidory has sustained her business activities through her two past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: o purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a married woman with six children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anecita is 48 years old and has three of her children attend school.

Anecita has a plastic bag making business in the Philippines. She requests a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Anecita has been in business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Moriba town is a small town not far from Bo city in Sierra Leone.

Please meet Zainab, a woman who sells fish at a busy market in the town.

Zainab is 29 and is married to a local man. They have two children; the oldest is 8 and the youngest is 3. Zainab decided to start selling fish some years ago to support her husband’s income and ensure that they could always pay their children’s school fees.

Zainab works six days a week for 8 hours each day. In order to purchase the fish to sell to her customers, Zainab must travel to ports such as Tombo. The high transportation costs in the region are therefore a challenge to Zainab’s business. Despite this challenge she says her business is going well. 

Zainab has previously taken out, and dutifully repaid, 3 loans from BRAC Sierra Leone for her business. She wants to use this loan to purchase more fish from her supplier to sell to her customers. 

Zainab says a big thank you to the Kiva community for helping her grow her business and look after her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish from her supplier to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Geogette

texts.en:
Geogette,45, has a live-in partner and three children.  Two children attend school.

Geogette has a fish vending business in the Philippines and she is a very hard working entrepreneur.. 

Geogette requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Geogette has been in this business for five years. In the future, Geogette would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to sell more spicy stews ("cookery") to her customers.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a 54 year old married woman with four children with ages 18 to 27. She describes herself as God fearing and humble. 

She sells sugar, milk, tea leaves and other items.  Fridah has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are the general public. Fridah says her biggest business challenge is a lack of funds. 

Fridah will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy sugar, milk, tea leaves and other items. 

Her business goal is to enlarge her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will empower her whole community. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, tea leaves and other items.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 33 años de edad y es una persona responsable que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, a la agricultura y a la ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras productos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, ella agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Victoria, 33, is a responsible person who works in farming and animal husbandry.  She has some land where she cultivates potatoes, barley, wheat, beans, and other products.  She belongs to the communal bank "Nueva Esperanza," and at this time she needs a loan to buy seeds.  She thanks the lenders for this loan, and she promises to make the payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.en:
Ambrosia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a video gaming machine business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and pay for electricity, etc. for her business.

Ambrosia has been in this business for five years. She earns more income by making rugs and by operating a general store.

Ambrosia has sustained her business through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, pay electric bill, etc.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rug making business in the Philippines.

Cerila requested a loan of PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy additional fabric for her business.

Cerila has been in this business for six years now.

Cerila would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fabric.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 29 years old and has a live-in partner with one child. Cheryl works very hard to provide for them.

Cheryl runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, biscuits, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Cheryl has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, biscuits, detergent soap, etc. 

Cheryl would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, biscuits and detergent soap,

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Christina is 30 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Christina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Christina requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Christina has been in this business for four years. In the future, Christina would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, se ha decidido por otro crédito con el que comprará pan, yuca, maíz, azúcar, pollo, plátanos, condimentos, aceite, hojas de huerta etc., para fortalecer el negocio y mantenerse trabajando, espera que su producción aumente, tener nuevos clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.
Con el financiamiento anterior tuvo los insumos necesarios para elaborar las diferentes meriendas, su negocio ha crecido, su familia se encuentra viviendo en mejores circunstancias.
texts.en: Blanca has decided to get another loan to buy bread, yucca, corn, sugar, chicken, bananas, condiments, oil, banana leaves, etc., to strengthen her business and continue working. She hopes to increase her production, have new customers and improve her income. With the prior financing she got the necessary supplies to prepare her various snack products. Her business has grown and her family is living in better circumstances.

loans.use: to buy bread, yucca, corn, sugar, chicken, bananas, condiments, oil, banana leaves, etc.

loans.name: Manzese B Group

texts.en:
ATUGANILE, who is in her early 40s, is single with four kids and only one is still in school.  She has been running a business of selling soft drinks for three years now.  She works from 7am to 6.30pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be ATUGANILE's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.   She used the previous loans to increase the soft drinks stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva's support which has made her group laugh with their families.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy soft drinks to meet her customer's demand. She dreams of building her own house.

ATUGANILE will share this loan with her loan group "MANZESE B" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy  soft drinks to meet her customer's demand.

loans.name: Somos Progreso Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Somos Progreso” La cual  está constituida por 08 socios emprendedores y entusiastas. Victoria de 45 años de edad es casada con 01 hijo independiente. Ella se dedica  a la venta de productos de belleza. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida. Su mayor anhelo es implementar su local para poder exhibir sus productos.  Solicitó el crédito para la compra perfumes, colonias, desodorantes y talcos. El grupo “Somos Progreso” agradece a todas las personas que facilitaron este crédito. Victoria se encuentra en la parte posterior es la tercera del lado derecho y viste polo morado.
texts.en:
This new group named “Somos Progreso” consists of eight enterprising and enthusiastic members.

Victoria is 45 years old, married, and has one child who is independent. She sells beauty products and the income she earns has enabled her to improve her quality of life. Her greatest wish is to promote her shop by being able to display her products. She is requesting a loan in order to buy perfumes, colognes, deodorants, and talcum powders.

The group “Somos Progreso” thanks everyone who facilitated this loan. In the photo, Victoria is standing in the back, third from the right, and wearing a purple shirt.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, colognes, deodorants, and talcum powders.

loans.name: Kamada

texts.en:
Kamada is 30 years old and a resident of Lusaze, a city suburb. He is married and has one child, who attends school.

Kamada rides a motorcycle in the city outskirts. This is where he earns a living for his family. He started this job in 2009 because it was the easiest business to start since he had little capital. He will use this loan to buy a motorcycle.

His major challenges are a lack of capital and competition, which slows down the growth of his business. This affects not only his business but also his family’s standard of living.

Kamada is very hard working, social and honest. His dreams are to see his children successfully finish school, to build his own home and to have many motorcycles. 

Kamada is pictured seated on a motorcycle with his guarantor and the Ugafode credit officer (left).

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
Clarissa is 31 years old has a live-in partner and five children; three attend school.  

Clarissa is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

Clarissa requests a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Clarissa has been in this business for five years.  In the future, Clarissa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Concianita

texts.en:
Concianita has a live-in partner and eight children, She works hard to support her family.

Concianita has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns income by buying and selling ready to wear clothing. 

Concianita is seeking to borrow PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Concianita has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to secure a good future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Melapa

texts.en:
Melapa is a 61-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small canteen in the village where she sells to the public in the surrounding community to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. 

She has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, boxes of noodles, plastic cups & plates for her business and to pay school fees for her children's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. 

With her profits, Melapa hopes to expand her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, boxes of noodles, plastic cups & plates, and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Sauilemau

texts.en:
Sauilemau is 32 years old with 2 children. She wants to start a small business, making and selling popcorn in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a cooking stove, pots & pans, cooking oil, corn seeds, plastic bags and salt to start up her business and to pay for her business license. 

In the future, Sauilemau hopes to improve and expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a cooking stove, pots & pans, cooking oil, corn seeds, plastic bags, salt and to pay for a business license.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 26 años de edad y es una persona responsable que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, a la agricultura y a la ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras productos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono, ella agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Lucía is 26 years old. She is a responsible person who earns her living raising young animals, farming, and cattle ranching. She has several fields of crops where she grows potatoes, barley, wheat, broad beans, and other products. 

Lucía belongs to the "Nueva Esperanza" [New Hope] communal bank. At this time, she requires a loan to purchase fertilizer. She is grateful to the lenders for the loan, and she promises to make her loan payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en:
