Mariela was compensated by the company she worked for, she invested the money in school supplies, paper products and little buy little added clothing and  cosmetics depending on what her clients requested. She formed ties with multinational supply companies which offer products via specialized product guides and catalogs. 

Her business opens at 6:30 am and she finishes taking care of her clientele at 10 pm. 

Currently she is requesting a CrediKiva, a loan given by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy school supplies, hair products, cosmetics as well as clothes and shoes. 

Her CrediKiva is aimed to  improve her inventory by updating it and moving it quickly. 

This is exactly why the CrediKiva is a great investment since she is planning on improving her store again.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, hair products, cosmetics as well as clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, está preparando todo para su próxima siembra y necesita capital para comprar abono, semilla, pesticidas, plaguicidas y cerdos, para dar un mejor tratamiento a su cultivo  y fortalecer el negocio.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a tener una cosecha abundante y libre de plagas, su situación económica ha mejorado notablemente y su familia está gozando de un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
María is preparing for her next sowing and needs capital to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, insecticides and pigs in order to give better treatment to her crops and strengthen the business. 

The previous loan helped her to have an abundant harvest free of infestations. Her economic situation has notably improved and her family is enjoying a better way of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, insecticides and pig.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назире 33 года, замужем, 3 детей. У Назиры среднее образование, по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Супруг и дети помогают по бизнесу. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 2010 году с 55,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в хозяйстве Назиры имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 4 лошади, 22 овцы и 13 коз. Ее деятельность приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом  на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Назира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также в будущем хочет купить земельный участок.
texts.en: Nazira is 33, married and has 3 children.  She has the equivalent of a high-school education and, character-wise, is calm, even-tempered and hardworking.   Nazira raises livestock for a living, and her husband and children help her run the family farm.  She first set up her farm in 2010 with 55,000 som worth of capital; thanks to her persistence, she currently has four dairy cows, four horses, twenty-two sheep and thirteen goats, and makes nearly 12,000 som a month.  This money is the family's lifeline for food and other daily needs.  To further develop her farm, Nazira is seeking a loan from Bai-Tushum & Partners to buy more cows.  She plans on reinvesting any additional income due to the loan back into her farm, and hopes to eventually buy a new plot of land.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Nelson Ulices

texts.es:
La clave del éxito es la dedicación y las ganas de triunfar, afirma  Nelson, quien a pesar de su corta edad, ya cuenta con su propia tienda. Todo se lo debe al esfuerzo y entusiasmo  que ha poseído desde joven. Sus primeros  pasos al mundo laboral fueron atendiendo clientes en una tienda de electrodomésticos y fue vendedor ambulante de ropa. Logró ahorrar y alquilar un espacio  dentro del mercado para  ofrecer a los visitantes calzados  y artículos escolares.
Nelson solicitó un financiamiento en KIVA con el  propósito de invertir en más mercadería, para brindarle a su clientela  mucha variedad en artículos escolares y calzado.  Además planea vender ropa veraniega  ya que se acerca la temporada  de verano en el país. KIVA ha sido un pilar fundamental  en su vida, sin esta institución sus sueños nunca se  hubieran realizado. Su familia puede gozar de mejores condiciones de vida gracias a ellos.
texts.en:
The key to success is dedication and a desire to overcome, says Nelson, who in spite of his young age, already has his own store. He owes it all to the effort and enthusiasm that he has had since he was young. His first steps into the work world were assisting clients in an electrical appliance store and being a street vendor of clothing. He managed to save and rent a space inside of a market in order to offer shoes and school materials to the visitors. 

Nelson requested financing from Kiva with the purpose of investing in more merchandise, so that he can provide his customers with a lot of variety in school materials and shoes. Furthermore, he plans to sell summer clothing seeing as the summer season is approaching in his country. Kiva has been a fundamental pillar in his life - without this institution, his dreams never would have come true. His family can enjoy better life conditions thanks to them.

loans.use: to provide his customers a lot of variety in scholarly materials and shoes.

loans.name: Luisa Gualupe

texts.es: Luisa se dedica a la venta de mates y jugos de forma ambulatoria desde las 4:30 am hasta 10 a.m. de lunes a viernes y le va muy bien entonces en esta oportunidad ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo azúcar, harina y otras cosas más, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Luisa sells herbal teas and juice on foot from 4:30 a.m. until 10:00 a.m. from Monday to Friday, and it is going very well.  On this occasion she is requesting a loan in order to purchase more supplies such as sugar, flour, and other items. 

She belongs to the communal bank, “Virgin del Rosario” [Virgin of the Rosary]. She appreciates and values the loan, and she promises to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as sugar and flour.

loans.name: Shailoo

texts.ru: Шайлоо 36 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Шайлоо - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Шайлоо занимается животноводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,500 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Шайлоо, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 дойных коров, 4 теленка, 10 лошадей, 4 жеребенка и 35 овец. Все условия для содержания скота имеются. Корма и сено заготовлены. Дополнительно Шайлоо со своей семьей занимается полеводством, выращивают картофель, кукурузу, клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шайлоо обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота, также для увеличения ежемесячного дохода от продажи молочных продуктов. Доходы от кредита Шайлоо планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на обучение детей.
texts.en: Shailoo is 36, married and raising 5 children together with her husband.  She has the equivalent of a high-school education and raises livestock for a living, first starting 16 years ago with 2,500 som worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistence, she currently has eight dairy cows, four calves, ten horses, four colts and thirty-five sheep on her farm, and makes nearly 10,000 som a month.  She has everything she needs to raise livestock.  All her hay and other fodder has been harvested and stored.  In addition to raising livestock, Shailoo also grows crops such as carrots, corn and clover.  To further develop her farm, she's seeking a loan from Bai-Tushum & Partners to buy more cows, which will allow her to produce and sell more dairy products each month.  She plans on using any additional income due to the loan to continue to buy more livestock, as well as to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Miriama Sandy

texts.en:
Miriama is a 23-year-old single lady who wants to help out her family through her business. She has a small plantation where she grows bananas, taro, taamu and others crops that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. 

Miriama needs a loan to buy a bush knife, chemicals, a mist blower and taro roots to help improve her crops. She has just joined SPBD to gain access to financial assistance, and hopes to be able to save some of her profits so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a  bush knife, chemicals, a mist blower and taro roots

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia nació en la comunidad de Huarancca el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo al sur de la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 28 años de edad  y es una persona responsable que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras productos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer fumigar los cultivos, ella agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo  y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Virginia was born in the community of Huarancca, which is in the District of Colquepata in Paucartambo Province. This area is located south of the city of Cusco. She is 28 years old and a responsible person who earns her living by farming and raising livestock. Virginia has several plots of land where she grows potatoes, barley, wheat, beans, and other crops.

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to pay for the fumigation of her crops. Virginia is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan, so she promises to handle her payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to pay for the fumigation of her crops.

loans.name: Melvin Ernesto

texts.es: Melvin tiene 29 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 6 años y su hijo de 5 meses de edad. Melvin trabaja como vendedor en una comercial cercana a su localidad y de esta forma junto a su compañera de vida van sacado adelante a sus hijos. Melvin y su familia habitan en condiciones muy humildes  por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para reconstruir la vivienda. De esta forma espera dar mejores condiciones de vida a su querida familia.
texts.en:
Melvin is 29 years old and resides in his own home along with his life companion, his six-year-old daughter, and his five-month-old son. He works as a salesperson at a shopping center near his town. His job allows him and his companion to help their children move forward.

Melvin and his family live in very modest conditions, so he decided to request a loan from FUSAI. He will invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets and wood so that he can rebuild his home. In this manner, he hopes to provide better living conditions for his beloved family.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets and wood so that he can rebuild his home.

loans.name: Dúo Paz Y Amor Group

texts.es:
Dúo paz y amor
Este dúo está conformado por Silvia de 57 años de edad casada y madre de familia ella esn originaria de Sumpango se dedica a la siembra de tomate y otras verduras además es muy buena administradora todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para poder dedicarse a su negocio es la primera vez que solicita un crédito y lo utilizara para poder comprar semillas para la siembra.
texts.en:
“Paz Y Amor” (Peace and Love) Group

This group includes Silvia, a 57-year-old mother who is married and originally from Sumpango. She grows tomatoes and other vegetables and is also a very good manager. Every day she wakes up very early so that she can carry out her business.

This is the first time that Silvia is requesting a loan. She will use the funds to buy seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta works hard to support four children. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Marieta requested a 7,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Marieta is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been operating a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines for seven years now. She earns additional income from a general store.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is requesting a new loan for PHP 29500 to buy more vegetables to resell at her stall. 

Jocelyn dreams of building and expanding her enterprise to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Addy

texts.es: Addy  de 57 años de edad es cosmetóloga y tiene una peluquería donde además ofrece mercancía asociada a la belleza y el mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional. Su experiencia de negocio data desde hace 4 años, cuando aprovechando su inclinación comercial y vocación hacia el mejoramiento estético, logró emprender en un punto de contacto su sala de belleza, que poco a poco ha ido aprovechando para agregar mercancías y promocionarlas con la gran cantidad de clientela que acceden a los servicios de corte, alicer, peinado, manicure, pedicure etc. Con lo que ha impulsado a un más sus ingresos. Sus sueños no se detienen y quiere lograr un mayor crecimiento de su negocio, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos capilares, fantasías, perfumería  y productos para el mejoramiento de la salud. Su sueño de prosperidad es lograr ingresos suficientes para apoyar a sus hijos, pero su mayor desafío es  lograr el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograr responder a los pedidos de su clientela,  incrementar sus ventas, ganar más dinero y alcanzar su meta de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Addy is 57 years old. She is a cosmetologist and has a salon where she also offers merchandise associated with beauty and the improvement of one's personal and professional image. Her business experience dates back four years, when taking advantage of her sales inclination and vocation toward aesthetic improvement, she was able to launch her beauty salon. Little by little she has gone making the most of [her situation] to add merchandise and promote it with the large amount of customers that get her cutting, straightening, styling, manicure and pedicure services. With it she has driven even more income. 

Her dreams do not stop. She wants to achieve a larger growth of her business. For this reason, she turns to a Kiva loan, the first financing she has done at the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy hair products, novelty items, perfumes and health products. Her dream of success is to achieve sufficient income to support her children, but her greatest challenge is to attain sufficient work capital to be able to respond to her customers' requests, boost her sales, earn more money and achieve her goal of success.

loans.use: to buy hair products, novelty items, perfumes and health products.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 47 years old.

Rosemarie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Rosemarie has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Jocelyn has buys and sells scrap materials in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Thoeun is 44 years old and lives with her spouse and children. She is a resident from Pursat province, where she operates a farming to earn a living. She primarily grows rice as her main products and sells it into the markets of the province. The biggest business challenges of her are pesticides, weeds and change of weather. Thoeun has been a rice farmer for more than 25 years. 

By applying for this loan Thoeun will use it to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and so as to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Thoeun is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 36 year old married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be organised and determined. He operates a carpentry where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy lumber for furniture making. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy lumber for furniture making

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 41 years old and married. Liezel works very hard to provide for her family.

Liezel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, soy sauce, sanitary napkins, noodles, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Liezel has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soy sauce, sanitary napkins, noodles, soft-drinks, etc. 

Liezel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like snack foods, soy sauce, sanitary napkins, noodles, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Saul Alfonso

texts.es:
Saúl, actualmente vive con su madre, por un tiempo estuvo viviendo en el extranjero, al regresar al país enfrento la dificultad de separarse de su esposa, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos, también hace trabajos de albañilería, con el fin de cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
El crédito le facilitara la compra cerdos y ganado para fortalecer el negocio, espera que su negocio tenga mayores utilidades para cancelar su deuda y seguir apoyando a su madre con los gastos familiares.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando para cumplir con sus compromisos familiares.
texts.en:
Saúl currently lives with his mother. For a while, he was living abroad; upon returning to his country, he faced the difficulty of separating from his wife. He earns his living raising cattle and pigs. He also does construction work in order to cover his household costs. 

This loan will enable him to buy pigs and cattle to strengthen his business. He hopes that his business will have better profits so he can pay off his debt and continue helping his mother with family expenses. His dream is to continue working to fulfill his family obligations.

loans.use: to buy pigs and cattle

loans.name: Jose Saturnino

texts.es:
José, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos y hortalizas, lo aprendió desde muy joven, en la zona no tiene mucha competencia, es casado, vive con su esposa y tres hijos que ya son adultos, ellos lo apoyan en sus trabajos.
Con el crédito comprara abono, fertilizantes y semilla mejorada para hortalizas, está inversión le permitirá tener todo listo para sembrar sus cultivos y surtir a su clientes con productos frescos y sanos, espera tener un aumento en su cosecha y mejorar sus ingresos.
Su deseo es seguir trabajando y mejorar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
José grows basic grains and vegetables. He learned this when he was very young. In his zone he doesn't have much competition. He is married and lives with his wife and three children, who are already adults. They help him with his work.

With the loan, he will buy compost, fertilizers, and improved seed for vegetables. This investment will allow him to have everything ready to plant his crops and supply his customers with fresh, healthy products. He hopes to have an increase in his harvest and improve his income.

His wish is to continue working and improve the family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and improved seeds for vegetables

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Milagroso Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “Señor De Huanca Milagroso”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Genara tiene 72 años de edad tiene 05 hijos y es viuda, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como leche, arroz, azúcar entre otros, la socia a la vez vende fruta en su negocio, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que e pone cada día su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar y arroz.
 
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de vinos, negocio de venta de frutas, movilidad escolar, artesanía, negocio de restaurante.
La socia que sale adjunta en la foto pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These communal bank members belong to the communal bank "Señor de Huanca Milagroso." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

One of the members, Genara, is 72 years old. She has five children and is a widow. She alternates her daily activities with her business, a grocery store. She sells basic products such as milk, rice, and sugar, among other items. She also sells fruit in her business. She has had this business for quite a while, and it is going well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue helping her family.

She is applying for the loan to buy sugar and rice.

The other members work in businesses such as selling wine, selling fruit, school transport, handicrafts, and a restaurant. The member who is adjacent in the photo asked permission to arrive late for the meeting because of work reasons.

The communal bank member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice for her store.

loans.name: Margot Bonifacia

texts.es:
La socia Margot Bonifacia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margot Bonifacia continues with her grocery store and restaurant business.  She sells basic needs products like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She has been in this business for five years, and it is going very well for her.

Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ángela recibió la mejor enseñanza de manos de su abuela. Desde los quince años ella le transmitió todo los conocimientos necesarios para dedicarse a la venta de pan. Sus ganas de aprender no finalizaron ahí, también se interesó en estudiar técnicas para la elaboración de pasteles, asimismo, en su decoración.  Cuenta con doce años de experiencia, logrando una  mayor clientela  que la ha preferido por  la excelente calidad de sus productos.
El propósito de Ángela es aumentar  la  producción y el nivel de ventas.  Es por eso que solicitó  un préstamo en Mi Crédito y KIVA con la finalidad de comprar suficientes productos y utensilios. Entre sus proyectos futuros esta la  construcción de un horno más grande, que le permitirá elaborar una mayor cantidad de pan. De esa manera su negocio crecerá y le brindará  mejores ganancias para su beneficio.
texts.en: Ángela  received the best training from the hands of her grandmother. Since Ángela  was fifteen years old her grandmother passed on all of the knowledge necessary to devote herself to the sale of bread. Her desire to learn did not end there. She was also interested in studying pastry baking techniques as well as pastry decoration. She has 12 years of experience during which she has obtained a large clientele who have a preference for her because of the excellent quality of her products. Ángela's goal is to increase her production and level of sales. It is because of this goal that she sought a loan from Mi Crédito and Kiva with the purpose of purchasing sufficient goods and utensils. Among her future projects is the construction of a bigger oven that will allow her to make a large quantity of bread. This way her business will grow and provide her with better earnings for her benefit.

loans.use: to purchase sufficient goods and utensils.

loans.name: Loydith

texts.en:
Loydith is 38 years old and has a live-in partner with three children. With one child currently in school, Loydith works very hard to provide for them.

Loydith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Loydith has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cereals, sugar, coffee, soft-drinks, noodles, eggs, etc. 

Loydith would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal roofing material and beams

loans.name: Nayibi

texts.es: Nayibi  de 46 años de edad, habita en la linda e histórica ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, ubicada a orillas del Mar Caribe.  Allí desde hace 9 años, se dedica a vender mercancía variada, actividad a la que la impulsó su hermana, quien es una mujer comerciante muy exitosa. Los productos de la oferta de Nayibi son los muebles como mecedoras, espejos, armarios y hasta floreros, que decoran los interiores de las viviendas habitadas por las familias. Todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche Nayibi   trabaja en la venta de estos productos, intentando cumplir su meta de hacer crecer su negocio. Con sus hermosos muebles traídos desde San Pues, un pueblo ubicado en el departamento de Sucre, donde sus habitantes trabajan manualmente la mueblería, especialmente tejida, Nayibi muy alegre y segura de su oferta promociona estos  artículos, para ganar cada vez más clientes y lograr su meta y gran desafío familiar, que es  la de educar a sus hijos en condiciones de calidad, para potencializar su éxito futuro. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mecedoras, espejos, cuadros y adornos, que poco a poco  con su impulso, formaran parte de los interiores de las familias cartageneras  a quienes  vende,  haciendo de su hogar un sitio muy agradable y elegante.
texts.en:
Nayibi, who is 46 years old, lives in the beautiful and historic city of Cartagena of the Indies, located on the shores of the Caribbean Sea. For nine years, she has been selling a variety of merchandise there, a business prompted by her sister, who is a very successful businesswoman. The products supplied by Nayibi are furniture such as rocking chairs, mirrors, wardrobes, and even vases, which decorate the interiors of the homes inhabited by the families. Every day from 8 in the morning until 9 at night, Nayibi works selling these products, trying to meet her goal of making her business grow. With her beautiful furniture brought from San Pues, a town located in the department of Sucre, where its inhabitants make furniture by hand, especially woven items, Nayibi is very happy and confident of her selection promoting these products in order to win more and more customers and achieve her goal and  great family challenge, which is that of educating her children in conditions of quality, to strengthen their future success.

She is now applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has requested from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy rocking chairs, mirrors, frames, and decorations, which little by little, with her impetus, will form part of the interiors of the Cartagena families to whom she sells, making their homes pleasant and elegant places.

loans.use: to buy rocking chairs, mirrors, frames, and decorations to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy skirts, dresses, shirts, powder, lipstick, lotion, and cream, among other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and meat, among others, as well as utensils and drinks.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.

Minda requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She has been in this business for three years now. Minda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de papas,la socia vende en el mercado,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local mas amplio para vender la papa.La socia solicita le credito para comprar papa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Hilda continues working at her business selling potatoes. She has been in the business for several years and things are going well for her. Her dream is to have a bigger space in which to sell her potatoes. She is requesting a loan to buy potatoes. Hilda is grateful for the loan and promises to pay the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia Gladys se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza y tambien sigue vendiendo zapatos y carteras, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Gladys continues with her business of selling beauty products and also continues to sell shoes and bags. She works from 8 am until 7 pm and she has been in this business for several years. Her dream is to have a commercial space to sell her product. Gladys is requesting a loan to buy creams, lipstick and perfume. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipstick and perfumes.

loans.name: Winrose

texts.en:
Winrose is a 30 year old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells bread, sweets, biscuits, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area ideal for the business. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of adequate capital. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sweets, and other items. Her business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread, sweets, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Hernan Alfonso

texts.es:
Perseverancia y dedicación, son dos palabras que definen a Hernán. Es un señor que ha buscado los medios para progresar, tiene 41 años, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Al entrar a su casa es notable la variedad de estilos y colores que ofrece, siempre atiende con amabilidad y respeto a su clientela, pues desea que regresen nuevamente. Hace un año y medio entró en el negocio de la venta de chinelas, la que por el momento es su principal fuente de ingresos. Su motivación principal es su familia.
Hernán solicita un financiamiento, lo requiere para la compra de variados estilos de chinelas, tanto para niños como para adultos. Anhela seguir enfocado en el trabajo para incrementar su negocio, desea brindarles un futuro lleno de posibilidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Perseverance and dedication are two words which define Hernán. He is a man who has looked for ways to get ahead in life. He is 41 years old and married, with three children. Upon entering his house, one notices the variety of styles and colors he offers. He always serves his customers with friendliness and respect, since he wants them to come back again. He started his business selling sandals and slippers a year and a half ago, and it is currently his main source of income. His chief motivation is his family. 

Hernán is requesting a loan which he needs to buy various styles of sandals and slippers, for both children and adults. He aims to stay focused on his work in order to expand his business, and he wants to provide his children with a future full of possibilities.

loans.use: to buy various styles of sandals and slippers for children and adults.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La socia se sigie dedicando al negocio de fabricacion de tejas y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos,la socia vende trigo,cebada y miaz,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender los granos secos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz,trigo y cebada.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota .
texts.en: Anastacia continues her business of making tiles and also continues with her business of selling dry grains. She sells wheat, barley and corn. She has been in the business for several years and things are going well for her. Anastacia's dream is to have a commercial space to sell her grains. She is requesting the loan to purchase wheat, barley and corn. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy corn, wheat and barley.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be future-oriented. He operates a retail business where he sells wet-cell batteries, battery acid, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

He will use the 20,000 Kes. loan to buy more stock of wet-cell batteries, battery acid, and other items. His business goal is to have a bigger shop within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of wet-cell batteries, battery acid, and other items.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a big boutique within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes, onions, carrots and other items.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She describes herself as honest and passionate. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells bananas, cabbages, onions, tomatoes, and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are regular customers. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bananas, cabbages, onions, and fruits. 

She hopes that in the future she will raise the living standards of her family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas, cabbages, onions, and fruits.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.es: Tereza de 58 años de edad, se dedica a la fabricación de prendas de vestir en su hogar ubicado al sur de la ciudad, donde habita con su conyuge y sus 2 hijos mayores de edad. Su experiencia data de hace 40 años, cuando aprendió con su madre el oficio de confeccionar de manera informal, aprovechando su aptitud y potencial de perfeccionamiento en esta tarea. Su madre la  incluyó en cursos técnicos y también a sus amigas, para que juntas aprendieran y se entusiasmaran en este oficio. Fue a sus 23 años cuando trabajó para otras costureras y poco tiempo después se independizó, iniciando con su máquina “Negrita ZZ” ayudada por su cónyuge quien le refirió compañeros, vecinos familiares etc, para fortalecer la acción emprendedora. Hoy se dedica a maquilar productos de confecciones para diferentes empresas y también fabrica camisas, vestidos de mujer, etc por su propia cuenta, sobre las medidas de cada cliente. En su negocio se realizan a nivel general, todas las operaciones de la confección, desde el diseño, corte, preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas, a excepción de cuando maquila, que las empresas de cada contrato, envían las piezas cortadas para su armado.  En la actualidad vende de contado y trabaja sin cesar, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche y de acuerdo a los contratos de maquila, así mismo extiende su jornada laboral, de lunes a domingos. Su meta es continuar ampliando su negocio, y su propósito es que sus hijos logren encargarse de la  microempresa de confección, pero su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente capital  de trabajo, para lograr que muy pronto se realicen sus sueños de prosperidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará 2 nuevas máquinas industriales, para aumentar su competitividad y adquirir muchos más contratos, que aumenten sus ingresos. Con ello su clientela se sentirá satisfecha pues la calidad de sus productos mejorará con su excelente trabajo y este será también el éxito de su crédito mediante Kiva.
texts.en:
Tereza, age 58, works making clothing in her home which is located south of the city, where she lives with her husband and her two grown children. 

Her experience dates back 40 years, when she learned sewing from her mother without formal training, developing her aptitude and potential for mastery of this work. Her mother enrolled her in technical courses and she also enrolled her friends, so that they would learn together and become excited about this occupation.  She worked with other seamstresses at age 23, and a short time later she became independent, starting out with her sewing machine, “Negrita ZZ”. Her husband helped her, supporting her enterprise by referring associates, neighbors, relatives, etc. to her.

Nowadays she assembles articles of clothing for various firms, and she also makes women’s shirts and dresses that are made to measure for each client, on her own. In her business she carries out all the activities involved in sewing--from the designing, cutting, preparation and assembling, to the finishing of the pieces--with the exception of the contract work that she does for the companies that send her cut pieces to assemble. 

Currently she sells on a cash basis, and she works steadily from 6 in the morning until 10 at night; and depending on the contracts that she has for assembling, she extends her work week from Monday to Sunday. Her goal is to continue expanding her business and her intention is that her children will be able to take charge of the small dressmaking business. However, her biggest challenge is having sufficient working capital, so that she can achieve her dreams of prosperity soon. 

She is requesting a CrediKiva loan, her first financing with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase two new commercial machines, in order to increase her competitiveness and win more contracts that will add to her income.  Thus, her clientele will be satisfied, as the quality of her products will improve with her excellent work, and her Kiva loan will be her means of achieving success.

loans.use: to purchase two new commercial machines.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Myrna works hard to support her family. She has a video gaming machine business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store, buying and selling firewood and brooms. 

Myrna is borrowing 10000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her machines and payment of her electric bills for her video gaming machine business.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her machines and pay her electric bills.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a married woman with three children who attend school. She is 44 years old. Nena is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Nena has a direct-selling Avon and Personal Collection products business in the Philippines. Nena requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products from Avon and Personal Collection to sell.

Nena has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Nena would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Avon and Personal Collection to sell.

loans.name: Jenry

texts.es: Jenry de 43 años de edad, es un hombre casado y padre de 3 hijos en las edades de 10, 14 y 17 años. Para generar ingresos y fomentar el bienestar de su familia, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hayacas y deditos de queso, además de vender carne de res y vísceras en pequeñas cantidades, de acuerdo al consumo de las familias ubicadas alrededor de su negocio, las cuales son atraídas por la calidad de su servicio.  Su idea de negocio nació desde el año 2007 cuando decidió dedicarse a la venta de carne de res en un expendio, para generar ingresos familiares,  el cual fue fortalecido en el año en el año 2011, cuando su suegra le enseñó a elaborar hayacas y deditos de queso y desde entonces, observando su rentabilidad y rotación, no ha dejado de venderlos, adicionándolos a su antiguo expendio de carnes. Su meta es continuar el crecimiento de su negocio , por eso se esmera trabajando de 8 horas diarias, de lunes a domingos, vendiendo a crédito y de contado, a sus principales clientes, que son sus propios vecinos, amigos y referidos de estos últimos. Su meta es mejorar su infraestructura locativa  y su meta familiar es lograr mayores ingresos, para que sus hijos logren obtener estudios profesionales que potencialicen su éxito. Su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente dinero para invertir y lograr que sus utilidades sean mayores. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará pescado de mar, mojarras, cárnicos, harinas, hojas de bijao para envolver las hayacas e insumos suficientes para incrementar la producción y vender más, aprovechando la semana mayor que se acerca y el consumo de alimentos se incrementa, tal como lo señala el enfoque de prosperidad que dirige las acciones de Jenry
texts.en:
Jenry is 43 years old. He is a married man and the father of three children, ages 10, 14, and 17 years. To generate income and promote the wellbeing of his family, he earns his living making and selling "hayacas" [leaf-wrapped tamales] and "cheese fingers" [dough-wrapped cheese sticks]. He also sells beef steaks and organ meat in small quantities, corresponding to the consumption of the families living near his business, who are attracted by the quality of his service. 

His business idea was born in the year 2007, when he decided to earn his living selling beef in a small shop to generate income for his family. It was strengthened in the year 2011, when his mother-in-law taught him to make hayacas and cheese fingers. Since then, seeing his profitability and turnover, he has not stopped selling them. He prepares them in his former meat market.

His goal is to continue growing his business, so he works hard eight hours a day from Monday to Sunday, selling to his regular customers on credit or for cash. They are his own neighbors and friends, or people referred by them. His goal is to improve his shop infrastructure, and his family goal is to increase his income so that his children can obtain professional educations to promote their success. 

His greatest challenge is having enough money to invest and achieve greater profits. This is the reason he is turning to a Kiva loan, his first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the loan, he will buy ocean fish, freshwater tilapia, meats, flours, bijao leaves [Calathea lutea] for wrapping the hayacas, and enough supplies to increase his production and sales to take advantage of the upcoming holy week. Consumption of foods will increase, as will the focus on prosperity, which drives Jenry's actions.

loans.use: to buy ocean fish, freshwater talapia, meat, flour, leaves for wrapping hayacas [traditional tamales], and supplies.

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria con su anterior credikiva, compró una maquina fileteadora  y prestó un servicio adicional de fileteo que le genera un ingreso nuevo, además de ofrecerle a sus clientes una mejor calidad en la prendas que elabora. Por eso dice a sus financiadores: “Gracia por la ayuda pues me sirvió mucho”. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará tela, hilos e insumos de confección, con lo cual planea producir más y vender en un mayor volumen, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa. Con su nueva máquina de filetear, trabaja cómoda desde su casa y ayuda un poco más a su familia y esto hace que se sienta satisfecha.
texts.en:
Maria with her last loan bought a overlock sewing machine (serger) and offers the additional services performed by this machine (serge stitching) which generates new income. She can also offer her clients a better quality of clothing. So she has this to say to the people who lent to her " Thank you for the support, it was a great help".

Maria is now requesting another loan from Kiva with which she will buy fabric, thread and sewing supplies. She plans to produce more and sell in greater volume making it a successful investment of a loan from Kiva. With her new serger she can work comfortably from her house and this makes her happy.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Luz Noemi

texts.es:
Luz, es reconocida por ser una persona luchadora y emprendedora en su comunidad, es casada, vive con dos hijos de 19 y 10 años de edad, por la necesidad de cubrir gastos familiares se decidió por hacer la apertura de un comedor, negocio que tiene desde hace 10 años, sus labores inician de 7.00 p.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m., su buena ubicación le da una gran ventaja.
Comprará carnes, pollo, embutidos, arroz, verduras, bebidas, condimentos, aceite, etc., que le permiten preparar los diferentes platillos que son del agrado de sus clientes, espera tener un negocio más rentable.
Su aspiración es dar a su familia un futuro con mejora alimentación, salud, vestuario y educación.
texts.en: Luz is known for being a hardworking and entrepreneurial person in her community. She is married and she lives with her two children who are 19 and 10 years old. Because of the need to pay for the family expenses she decided to open a canteen, a business that she has had for 10 years. She works from 7 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon. The good location of her business gives her a great advantage. She will purchase meats, chicken, sausages, rice, vegetables, drinks, condiments, oil, etc. which will allow her to prepare the different meals that are the favorites of her customers. She hopes her business will be more profitable. Her goal is to provide her family with a future full of better nutrition, health, dress and education.

loans.use: to purchase meats, chicken, sausages, rice, vegetables, drinks, condiments, oil, etc.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 30 años de edad y reside junto a su madre y padrastro en casa familiar. Carlos trabaja como auxiliar de albañil y sueña en convertirse en un buen albañil independiente en el futuro. Carlos desea invertir en la mejora de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y una puerta dado que desea encementar el piso de la vivienda y poner la puerta del cuarto de la madre.  De esta  forma espera dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Carlos is 30 years old and lives together with his mother and step-father in the family home. Carlos works as an assistant bricklayer and dreams of becoming an professional independent bricklayer in the future. Carlos wants to invest in some improvements to their house. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand and a door. He wants to cement in the floors of the house and finish his mother's room with a door. He hopes to provide his family with better living conditions by doing this.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and a door to cement in the floor of his house and install the door in a room.

loans.name: Andrea Marisa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de ropa,la socia vende pantalones,blusas y chompas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.n,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y el va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pantalones,blusas y chompas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Andrea Marisa continues running her business purchasing and selling clothes. She sells pants, blouses and sweaters. She works from 8:00 in the morning to 6:00 in the evening. She has spent many years in this business and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell the clothing. She is seeking this loan to purchase pants, blouses and sweaters. 

Andrea Marisa is happy to receive this loan and she promises to complete her payment installments.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses and sweaters.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself as focused and honest. He operates a farm, where he grows carrots, potatoes and peas. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a busy and productive area, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of enough farm inputs to increase production.

Isaiah will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. His business goal is to do large-scale farming within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be happy. This is his first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is married and has a business selling bread in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. Paulina has been in this business for 10 years now.

Paulina requested a 12,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase more bread to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale shirts, polos, blouses, pants, and skirts.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling firewood and brooms.

Rosalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF). She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional goods, such as candies, shampoo, cooking oil, sanitary napkins, soft drinks, detergent soap, etc., to sell in her general store business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods, such as candies, shampoo, cooking oil, sanitary napkins, soft drinks, detergent soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz Inés de 42 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de refrescos y ofrece servicios de llamadas a celulares y recargas de internet, en su vivienda donde habita con su conyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 10 a 13 años.  Luz Inés atendiendo a su necesidad de ingresos familiares, se había dedicado a la venta de pizzas y de comidas rápidas, posteriormente puso una tienda de ranchos víveres de la canasta familiar y un servicio de internet, al que agregó llamadas a celulares y venta de refrescos de acuerdo con la demanda de su mercado. Hoy ha clasificado su demanda y segmentado su negocio, ofreciendo lo que su clientela requiere, para ello trabaja diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche sin cesar, comprando de contado en almacenes y algunos proveedores llevan a sus puertas los productos que ella vende. Su meta es lograr un mayor surtido y ampliar la infraestructura de su local, y su mayor desafío es lograr adquirir una casa propia y hacer de sus hijas profesionales de éxito; por eso no detiene su trabajo, con el fin de lograr llevarlas hasta la cima de éxito. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará un carro de perros calientes, e insumos como salsas, cárnicos etc, con el fin de dinamizar aún más sus ingresos y poco a poco alcanzar  su sueño de prosperidad y esto es lo que hace que su credikiva tenga un potencial de éxito.
texts.en: Luz Inés is 42 years old. She works selling refreshments and she offers cell phone call services and internet access from her home where she lives with her spouse and her two children who are 10 and 13 years old. Luz Inés meets the needs of the family expenses. She has worked selling pizzas and fast food. Later she opened a grocery store and an internet service at her family home and she added cell phone calls and the sale of refreshments to meet the demand of the market. Today she has identified her demand and segmented her business, offering what her customers require. She works daily from 8 in the morning until 10 in the evening without stopping. She purchases her inventory in cash from warehouses and a few suppliers who bring the products that she sells to her door. Her goal is to acquire a greater variety of products and to increase the infrastructure in her stall. Her top goal is to complete the purchase of her own home and to raise her children to be successful professionals. Because of this she does not stop working with the goal of bringing her family to the highest level of success. Today she is applying for a Kiva loan that she will use to purchase a hotdog cart and supplies like sauces and meats, etc. with the goal of boosting her sales and little by little achieving her goal of prosperity. This potential for success is what the Kiva loan will provide.

loans.use: to purchase a hot dog cart and supplies such as sauces and meats, etc.

loans.name: Madai Gabina

texts.es:
La socia Madai Gabinase sigie dedicando al negocio  de venta de granos secos,la socia vende trigo,cebada y miaz,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender los granos secos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz,trigo y cebada. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Madai Gabinase continues to work in her business selling dry grains. She sells wheat, barley, and corn. She has been working in this business for several years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her dry grains. She is requesting the loan to buy corn, wheat, and barley.

She is happy because of the loan and pledges to complete her repayments.

loans.use: to buy corn, wheat, and barley.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 41-year-old married woman who describes herself as ambitious. For the past seven years she has sold fruits and vegetables. Her stall is located in a busy place, and she has both walk-in and regular customers. She says the biggest challenge for her business is the rainy season.

This will be Janet’s first loan with SMEP DTM. She is applying for a 20,000 KES loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes to be able to educate her children up to the highest level possible.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela, 50, is a married woman with seven children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past ten years she has worked hard running her sari sari, or general store.

Marcela is applying for a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chisels and polishers, in addition to wood.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marites works hard to support her family. She sells fruit and earns additional income from her sari sari, or general store.

Marites has been aided in her work through her past three loans from NWTF. She is now applying for a 11,000 PHP loan to buy more bananas to sell. Her ambition is to keep expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, 32, is married and has one child. When asked, he described himself as organized and goal-oriented.

For the past two years William has run a stall where he cooks food to sell. His business is located in an area with potential, and he has regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient capital.

This will be William’s fourth loan through SMEP DTM. He will use a 20,000 KES loan to buy ingredients to make his food with. His goal is to have a full-scale restaurant within five years.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make his food with.

loans.name: Miguelita

texts.en:
Miguelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a food stall for the past five years. She earns additional income from her sari sari, or general store.

Miguelita has been aided in her business activities through past loans through NWTF. She is now borrowing 29,000 PHP to buy ingredients for her recipes such as meat, vegetables and spices. She dreams of building her businesses so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production.

loans.name: Javan

texts.en:
Javan is a single man who describes himself as focused and visionary. For the past twenty years he has had a farm where he grows carrots, potatoes and peas. It is located near a busy area where he has customers of all types. His biggest challenge is a lack of enough farm inputs to increase production on his farm.

This will be Javan’s second loan through SMEP DTM. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy seed, fertilizer and other farming needs to improve his yield. His goal is to move into large-scale farming within five years. He hopes that the future will bring him improved living standards.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and other farming needs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 44 years old and married with five children. With all five children currently in school, Susan works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy more items to sell in her general store. Susan has been in her business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cereals, laundry soap, noodles, diapers, etc. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre, dos hermanos y su hija de 16 años de edad. María se gana la vida mediante la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace 5 años. Con mucho esfuerzo va saliendo adelante y tratando de dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. María desea reparar el techo de la vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de 2 docenas de lámina galvanizada y madera y así dar a su familia mayor seguridad.
texts.en: María is 41 years old and lives in her own house with her mother, her two brothers, and her 16 year old daughter. María has been earning a living by working as a domestic servant for the past 5 years. With much hard work she is getting ahead and trying to give her family better living conditions. María wants to repair the roof of her house, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of 2 dozen galvanized metal roofing sheets and wood so she can provide better security for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 dozen galvanized metal roofing sheets and wood to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Phay

texts.en:
Phay, a hard-working woman, is married and has one child who is attending school. She earns an income from rice husbandry and agriculture. She has been doing this for more than 20 years and has support from her husband. With her income, Phay usually pays for daily meals, home bills, clothes, and other commodities. She is photographed with her husband in the photo.

By applying for this loan, Phay will use it to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members, so as to improve her household's sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Phay is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar es un joven de 26 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de frutas y comidas; Hace 12 años empezó su vida como comerciante con sus padres qienes incursionaron primero en la venta de comidas y posteriormente la venta de frutas, actividad que de la misma manera desempeña hoy Oscar y en unión de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y su hijo de dos meses, dependen e su totalidad de ella. Su meta es ampliar su negocio en cobertura, dirigiendose a otros barrios y municipios cercanos. En la actualidad ha aplicado aun credikiva, mediante el cual comprará mayor volumen de frutas para adicionar un punto de contacto en un nuevo sector. Con este credikiva potencializará nuevos ingresos que es lo que hará de su inversión la mas exitosa.
texts.en: Oscar is 26 years old. He sells fruits and foods. He started his life as a merchant 12 years ago with his parents, who started out by selling foods and then later by selling fruits. This is the same business that Oscar operates today with his family, which is composed of his wife and his two-month old son. They depend completely on this business. His goal is to expand his business’s coverage, entering into other neighborhoods and towns nearby. He has applied for a Kiva loan, with which he will buy a greater volume of fruits so he can open a stand in a new area. With this Kiva loan, he will have the possibility of new income, which will make his investment successful.

loans.use: to buy a greater volume of fruits.

loans.name: Lidia Lucia

texts.es:
La sonrisa de Lidia es el arma principal que utiliza a la hora de atender a los clientes que visitan su pulpería diariamente. Su carisma y cortesía dan seguridad en su local.  Desde hace once años se dedica al comercio y poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo  hasta lo que es hoy.  Su gran inspiración son sus dos hijos, para quienes desea ofrecerle un mejor porvenir.
Lidia solicitó un financiamiento para la compra de: Arroz, Frijoles, Azucar, Avena entre otros con el fin de obtener un inventario fuerte. De esa manera podrá satisfacer las necesidades de todos sus clientes. La meta es convertir  su negocio en una pequeña distribuidora en un futuro.
texts.en:
Lidia's smile is her main tool used when serving customers who visit her store daily. Her charisma and courtesy provide security at her store.

For eleven years, she has been engaged in retail and gradually her business grew to what it is today. Her inspiration is her two children, to whom she wants to offer a better future.

Lidia has requested a loan for the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oats and other items in order to have a strong inventory. That way she can meet the needs of all her customers. Her goal is to turn her business into a small distribution company in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, oats and other items.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teófilo tiene 59 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cañaris, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Ferreñafe que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de cafeto de la variedad catimor, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevo soles para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Teófilo is 59 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Cañaris, a community that works in agriculture, commerce, and cattle. It’s located in the province of Ferreñafe, which belongs to the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He works in agriculture, especially cultivating coffee of the catimor variety. His wife helps him with this work. He has requested a loan of 1,000.00 PEN (Peruvian nuevos soles) to buy manure and fertilizers for his coffee crop so that he can have a good production to offer his clients, so that he can earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en: Yusra is a 27-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a vibrant location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 40-year-old woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be self motivated. She operates a food stall where she cooks fish to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are students. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish and pay school fees for her children. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved  living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anisia

texts.en: Anisia is a 32-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a green grocery where she sells bananas, carrots, oranges, onions and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy and business-friendly area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock to sell. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Emelito

texts.en:
Emelito is a married man with three children. He is a very hardworking entrepreneur. He is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Emelito has a business buying and selling bread in the Philippines. He requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bread to sell to his customers.

Emelito has been in this business for five years. In the future, he would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: purchase more bread to sell to his customers

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 47 years old and married with two children.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Thelma has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and firewood.

Thelma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is 53 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aurea has been doing pig fattening for 11 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Juliana requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Juliana has been in this business for 35 years now.

Juliana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as determined. Janet operates a retail business where she sells potatoes. She has been involved in this business for ten years. 

Janet's business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. Janet will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of potatoes. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have good living standards.

loans.use: buy more stock of potatoes

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun is 47 years old and lives in a peaceful village in the  Bakan district, Pursat province. Yun is married with three children who are now adults and are employed in various careers. Yun has been engaged in farming, particularly rice production activities, for 25 years already, and earns approximately USD 7.00 per day.

Yun will use the loan to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members in order to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Yun is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank

loans.name: Barnaba

texts.en: Barnaba is a 36-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a farm where he grows potatoes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are hotels. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. His business goal is to have a large farm within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 45 years old and has nine children. She is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Juliet is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Juliet has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Vanessa Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Vanessa Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Vanessa Jean is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more stock like cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, toothpaste, bath soap, canned goods, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Vanessa Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, toothpaste, bath soap, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 35 years old and married with eight children. With seven children currently in school, Michelle works very hard to provide for them.

Michelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries, such as eggs, soap detergent, shampoo, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.  Michelle has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries, such as eggs, soap detergent, shampoo, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ofelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.  She has been in this business for 12 years now.  Ofelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional box of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Luis Gabriel

texts.es: Luis de 33 años de edad habita en un municipio de tradición artesanal, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 13 y 7 años. Allí tiene su negocio mediante el cual presta el servicio de lavado de motos, y vehículos automotor. Luis inició su negocio en compañía de su hermano cuando se dedicaban a lavar motocicletas. Poco a poco fueron siendo reconocidos en el sector y hoy tienen una demanda que los solicita y sus equipos no son suficientes para lograr responder a ella. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará equipos de limpieza para poder ofrecer un servicio de calidad a los conductores y propietarios de vehículo que lo requieran. Su mayor desafío son las condiciones de infraestructura que posee pues  negocio necesita ser acondicionado para atender vehículos de mayor tamaño.  Su meta es tener un local suficientemente amplio, donde pueda atender vehículos de mayor potencia y amplitud y adicionar nuevos servicios automotrices que impacten el mercado y así mismo sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Luis, 33 years old, lives in a town of with a tradition of crafts.  He lives with his spouse and two children ages 13 and 7. There he has his business of providing the service of washing motorcycles and motor vehicles.

Luis started his business with his brother when they were washing motorcycles. Little by little, they became recognized in the neighborhood and now there is a demand and more people request their teams then they are able to handle.

The reason he is requesting a Kiva loan is in order to buy cleaning equipment to be able to offer a quality service to drivers and vehicle owners as required. 

His biggest challenge is the infrastructure that his business needs to be able to take care of larger vehicles. His goal is to have a sufficiently large establishment to be able to handle more powerful and wider vehicles and add new services that impact the automotive market and likewise his profits.

loans.use: to buy equipment to clean cars.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a 30-year-old married man with one child. He describes himself as optimistic. 

Samwel operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years.
