His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. Samwel will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy spare motorcycle parts, which will enable him to open a spare parts shop. His business goal is to own a tuk tuk within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy dairy cows for dairy farming. 

This is Samwel's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy spare motorcycle parts, which will enable him to open a spare parts shop.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 26 years old, and is married with two children. He describes himself to be determined. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of groceries, which will enable him to open a business for his wife. 

Vincent's business goal is to own three motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a car. This is Vincent's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy stock of groceries, which will enable him to open a business for his wife.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of agrochemicals and seeds

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a married man and has three children. He operates a transport business where he transports customers by motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. 

Ezekiel's business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of ingredients and other items to enable him to open a hotel for his wife. This will enable them to increase their family income. Ezekiel's business goal is to own at least two motorcycles within five years.

loans.use: buy stock of ingredients and other items to enable him open a hotel for his wife

loans.name: Pilika Pilika Group

texts.en:
Husein is a married father of three children, who are all in school. He is aged in his mid-thirties and is from Tujijenge, in Tanzania.

Since 1990, Husein has been running two businesses: a stall selling fruit and vegetables, and a retail shop. He opens his businesses from 7am to 7:30pm each working day, and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This is Husein's fourth loan request, and he will use this loan to buy bananas and buckets of cooking oil to resell. He used his previous loans (all of which he paid back successfully) to restock his stall with bananas for making food, fruits and vegetables. Husein also bought a fridge to keep soft drinks. He used his business profit to buy 200 bricks for house building, covered school fees and home food expenses. Husein dreams of expanding his business and improving his family life.

He will share this loan with his loan group "PILIKA PILIKA" which has three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy bananas and buckets of cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Wilma Melina

texts.es:
Wilma Melina tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará una comunidad de clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de arroz, café y frutales, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica la venta de chicha de jora en el mercado de su distrito desde hace cinco años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de maíz amarillo y azúcar para la elaboración de chicha de jora y de esta manera ofrecer en mayor cantidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Wilma Melina is 36 years old and lives with her spouse and children in the district of Pucara, a community with a warm climate. The population is engaged in agriculture, especially the cultivation of rice, coffee and fruit, and livestock trade, located in Jaén Province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

For the past five years, she has been selling chicha in the market in her neighborhood. She has requested a loan of 500 soles to buy yellow corn and sugar for making chicha and thus provide more product to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase yellow corn and sugar for making chicha.

loans.name: Erene

texts.en:
Erene is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Erene has requested a loan of  PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

In the future, Erene would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Alma has a buy and sell of used clothing business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Alma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 51 years old and married with one child.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  

Angelina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.  Angelina has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Angelina is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is 39 years old and married with three children.  She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. 

Basilia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Basilia has been farming sugarcane for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Basilia is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sun City Group

texts.en:
Sadiki is in his mid-twenties, and is a father of one child who is still young. 

Sadiki makes his living by running a barber shop. He has been in this business for three years, and is able to make a good monthly profit. He opens his barber shop from 7am to 10pm daily.

This is Sadiki's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy salon equipment. He dreams of opening other barbershop branches. He will share this loan with his loan group "SUN CITY" which has five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment for his barber shop.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 22-year-old single man from Qalqilia city. He lives with his parents and brothers in a small house in the city. His father is a construction worker with a low and unstable income. 

Imad would like to help his family and improve their living conditions. He would like to open a small butcher shop. It is a good business and the demand is high. Imad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him prepare his new butcher store and buy all the needed items, as well as some inventory. 
Imad appears in the photo in his new butcher shop.

loans.use: to prepare his new butcher store and buy all the needed items, as well as some inventory.

loans.name: Yassin

texts.en: Yassin is a 27-year-old married man. He describes himself as organized in his work. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to have more motorcycles within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is 29 years old and from Nyandarua South.  He is married with one child, who is three years old.

Micah has been a farmer for the past eight years. He has applied for his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy a cow.  He hopes to improve his business and improve his family's livelihood in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 30-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. 

Frederick operates a transport business where he transports customers using a motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are of all types. Frederick describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. His business goal is to own a tuk tuk within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own rental houses. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en:
Juliah is from Nyandarua South, Kenya. She is 50 years old, and is married with five children who are aged between 20 and 9 years old.

Juliah has been a farmer for years. She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her buy seedlings and fertilizers to use in her farm. The profits made will be used to repay the loan.

Juliah hopes to expand her farming and also boost her dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cattle to re-sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with three children. She is 47 years old, and has been in business for seven years now.

Joyce would like a loan of KES15,000 which she will use to purchase fertilizer and pay for ploughing the farm. This is her third loan term, and she has successfully repaid her previous loans. 

She anticipates that she will use her profits to repair worn out machinery. Her dream is that she will one day buy a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for ploughing the farm.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de San Felipe, una comunidad de clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de frutales y arroz, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo y venta de lima, cuenta con fincas de lima un aproximado de 02 ha de finca frutera, lo cosecha de manera mensual el cual lo vende en su caserío a los comerciantes de frutas quienes la llevan a comercializar a otras ciudades, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra por mantenimiento y compra de abonos para el cultivo de lima y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Faustino is 56 years old and he lives with his wife and children in the district of San Felipe, a warm area located in the Cajamarca Region, a mountain chain in the north of Peru. The population of San Felipe makes a living from agriculture, especially from growing fruit trees and rice, and from cattle raising and commerce.

Faustino grows and sells limes. He has approximately 2 acres of land planted with lime trees, which he harvests once a month. He sells the fruits in his farmhouse to wholesalers, who then sell them in other towns.

He is asking for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles to pay for the labor costs of maintenance and to buy fertilizer for his lime trees. With this, he hopes to generate higher income for his family.

loans.use: To pay for the labor costs of maintenance and buy fertilizer for his lime plantation.

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en: Nabi is a 48-year-old man, married and the father of four children. He lives in the Baki region with his family but for over 20 years they have been IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Lachin city. Nabi’s elder child is studying the first course of college. All of the other children are going to school. Nabi is a welder. He welds different construction areas by order. Today he wants to repair a broken apparatus and therefore he has applied to Komak Credit Union for a loan in the amount of 1300 Azerbaijan New Manat. He is thankful to Kiva for the help.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of a broken apparatus.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 24-year-old single man, who has been working in construction since 2007. He specializes in Gibson work - which is dealing with internal decoration.

Wissam is a very talented person in his field, and is recommended by most of his customers. He is working on developing and expanding his own business, instead of being employed by someone else. For this reason, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary newly released tools and machinery that are highly requested for his business development.

He is very anxious about this loan, since it is his first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower. He will work hard, and with his future expected profits, he will expand his working region by recruiting others to help him in replying to increasing customers' needs, and increasing his tools.

At the beginning, he had obstacles in developing his career, because he had no car to make his transportation easier. But today everything is becoming easier and solved in a well managed way. He hopes to open his own company in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary newly released tools and machinery that are highly requested for his business development.

loans.name: Somaya

texts.en:
Somaya is a 59-year-old widow who has been working for the past 13 years to raise her only child and make a living. Somaya is Palestinian, living in Ain Al Helwi Camp, the home of many Palestinians living in Lebanon.

Somaya sells perfume, shampoo and cosmetics to neighbors, relatives and friends. Her business is going just fine but she dreams of expanding it soon through opening a big shop. To increase her income, Somaya applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business capital with newly released cosmetics, perfumes and shampoos, suitable for the summer season.

This is Somaya's twelfth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with an excellent history of repaying loans. All of her previous loans helped a lot in improving her family's living, she said.

loans.use: to increase her business capital with newly released products, such as cosmetics, perfumes and shampoo.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is 60 years old and is widowed. She is a hardworking woman and is a careful mother of five children. 

She has been busy with her farming business for more than eight years. She grows wheat, maize etc. Fotima works hard from early morning. She sells her products in a local market where she has regular customers. Fotima must sow new seeds, but she does not have any money to buy seeds or mineral fertilizers. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for new sowing. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for new sowing.

loans.name: Salomatkhon

texts.en:
Salomatkhon was born in 1981. She is married and has one child who is 5 years old. She lives with her husband, child, and her husband's parents. Her husband is a farmer.

Salomatkhon is smart and hardworking woman. She is a higher-educated woman and has a medical education. She works in a local hospital where she is a family doctor. Salomatkhon has worked in a hospital for more than eight years. 

She needs some dental work but she does not have enough money to pay for it. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to pay for her dental work. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for dental work.

loans.name: Santos David

texts.es:
Santos Davis tiene 54 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de arroz, café y frutales, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura cuenta con un terreno agrícola propio cuenta con fincas de lima , cacao y otras frutas que los comercializa en su distrito, tiene clientela considerable, ha solcitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para sus cultivos y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Santos David is 54 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Pucará. It enjoys a warm climate and the people work in agriculture, specializing in growing rice, coffee, and fruit. Some people also raise animals. The community is located in Jaén Province, part of the region of Cajamarca in the mountains in the north of Peru.

Santos David is also a farmer. He has his own land where he grows lima beans, cocoa, and other fruit which he sells locally to his many customers. He is seeking a loan of 3,000 soles to buy manure for his fields. Then he will have a lot of produce to offer to his customers.

loans.use: Buy manure for his lima beans fields

loans.name: Bernar

texts.en:
Bernar is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of her mother. 

Bernar has been operating a retail shop for 20 years. She generates additional income from renting rooms. She works in the shop seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges includes seasonality, defaulters and the ever increasing price of commodities like soap, sugar and cooking oil which reduces her overall profits. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, small and big jerry cans of cooking oil, rice and loaves of bread. 

Bernar aspires of becoming a wholesaler and also of building more rental houses. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans. She lives in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, small and big jerry cans of cooking oil, rice and loaves of bread.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 45 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like coffee, cereals, chocolate drinks, eggs, noodles, bread, etc. to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cereals, chocolate drinks, eggs, noodles, bread, etc. 

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more coffee, cereals, chocolate drinks, eggs, noodles, and bread to sell

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc is requesting a new loan to buy tools and wood to make furniture and other wooden products. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tools and wood to make furniture and other wooden products.

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya runs a farm. She keeps five cows and has four colonies of bees. Ofelya also cultivates barley and sells the gathered harvest in local markets. Besides her farming activities, Ofelya also teaches at a local village school.
 
She lives with her husband and son, who is an army officer.
 
Ofelya has requested this loan of USD 3,000 to purchase necessary farming supplies. She plans to buy fertilizer and seeds, and hire workers for land cultivation. The loan will be a huge support for Ofelya to improve her farm and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds, and hire workers for land cultivation.

loans.name: Chafika

texts.en:
Chafika is a 53-year-old married mother of four children. 

In June 2013 she established her current convenience store to support her beloved husband in making their living and covering their increasing expenses. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages, especially the tasty ice cream, in addition to making necessary instalments to get electricity 24/7 to keep her products fresh and stored in a well managed way.

Chafika will work hard in the future to start a wholesale trade as an additional income business, that she will develop in a well managed way.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages, in addition to making necessary instalments to get electricity 24/7 to keep her products fresh and stored in a well managed way.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil is 45 years old and has been married for 21 years. He has two children. His daughter is 20 years old and a while ago she was married. His son is a jeweller by profession. 

Kamil has been a truck driver for over 20 years. He is engaged in transporting sand, gravel, stone etc with his truck. He has been unable to work for a while, because the tires of his truck need to be repaired. To repair the tires, Kamil needs a loan of 1,100 AZN. He hopes that his truck will be repaired as soon as possible so that he will be able to continue his work.

loans.use: to pay for repairs for his truck tires.

loans.name: Shahlokhon

texts.en:
Shahlokhon is married and has a son who is 14 years old. She lives with her family in North Tajikistan. 

Shahlokhon has operated her own business for over eight years. She is a sewer. Shahlokhon sews national womens clothes and has her regular customers. She sells from her workshop. 

She is the income earner of her family, as her husband has a small salary. She would now like to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 500 USD to buy fabric for her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her sewing business.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba was born in 1965. She is married and has four adult children. Her husband is a master at repairing houses. 

Mahbuba has been busy selling shoes for more than 13 years. She sells shoes in a local market. Every season she renews her assortment of goods, so that she attracts more customers and other businessmen. Her sister helps her with managing the business. 

Mahbuba wants to buy shoes for the new season, and is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to do so. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes for the new season.

loans.name: Oswaldo Lorenzo

texts.es:
Oswaldo Lorenzo tiene 57 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio , ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, su esposa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores gallinas y patos, son una familia emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para cubrir gastos de mantenimiento y reparación de una de su vehículo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Oswaldo Lorenzo is 57 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Pomahuaca. It enjoys a warm climate, and the people work in agriculture or run businesses. The community is located in Jaén Province, part of the region of Cajamarca in the mountains in the north of Peru.

Oswaldo Lorenzo works in transportation and has his own motorbike taxi. He drives his passengers to neighboring communities. His wife raises and sells chickens and ducks. They are an enterprising family. Oswaldo Lorenzo is seeking a loan of 1,200 soles to service and repair one of his vehicles. Then he will be able to earn more money for his family.

loans.use: Service and repair one of his vehicles

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 34 years old. He has been in the retail business for four years. He would like a loan of KES 99,390. This is his seventh loan term and he has paid back all his previous loans successfully. Through his loan he will be able to buy a generator and a water tank as well as increase his general store stock.

His current monthly income is KES 168,000. He anticipates that from the profits he generates he will be able to expand his business further with the intention of becoming a real estate owner. In the future, he hopes and dreams of building residential houses and becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy a tank and a generator

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 31-year-old married father of two children, for whom he sacrifices his whole life for their living and providing them with the best education ever.

Rabih has been working as a barber for fifteen years, since he had to start work early to financially support his family when they were in need. In 2008, he established his current barber shop, and his career is developing all the time; he is becoming more talented, and his customers are increasing. At the same time his family's living needs are increasing too, but his income isn't increasing enough to cover any sudden increased request. For this reason, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his childrens' increasing school tuition fees.

He is willing in the future to improve his shop's decoration to keep it attractive to his customers, and he might buy a car and set it for rental services as an additional income business.

loans.use: to pay for his childrens' increasing school tuition fees.

loans.name: Bibihafiza

texts.en:
Bibihafiza is 58 years old, and is married with two children. Her husband, Rahmad, is a plumber. 

Bibihafiza has a special education. She is a commodities expert. She has worked for more than nine years in a state organization. She uses her salary to buy food products and clothes for her children and herself. Bibihafiza always works hard for the well being of her children. Her son Bahtovar is a student, studying at the university. She is asking for a loan of 600 USD to pay for his tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 41-year-old mother of three children, who works hard with her husband to provide them with the necessary living needs. 

She has been working as a tailor from her house for 26 years. She has specially acquired talents, since she had to quit school during the intermediate level to start a tailoring business to support her parents in their living.

Today, Randa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy newly released updated tailoring machines necessary for developing her business and quality provided to customers.

She is very anxious about this loan, since it is her second experience with Al Majmoua. Through her previous loan, she was capable of renewing some of her machines. She puts so much effort on increasing her profits through buying new released machines when she can afford their set prices.

loans.use: to buy newly released updated tailoring machines necessary for developing her business and quality provided to customers.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 28 years old, married and blessed with one child. He has been in the retail business for five years. He currently makes a monthly income of KES.30,000. 

He is requesting a loan of KES.120,000 which he will use to purchase stock like rice, sugar and cooking oil for his general store. He hopes that with his profits, he will be able to educate his child and expand his business. He has successfully repaid all his previous loans, this being his fourth loan term.

In the future, Bernard hopes and dreams that he will have a stable business and open a salon for his wife.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like rice, sugar and cooking oil for his general store.

loans.name: Romas

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Romas. He is married and has eight children, all of them are in school. Romas sells Coca-Cola products on a wholesale basis to local retailers and customers in Mandevu compound, a high-density area north of the capital city in Lusaka, Zambia.

Romas has been running his business for nineteen years. On any given day, Romas can be found at the red and white shipping containers filled with crates of Coke, Fanta and Sprite. He enjoys running his business because it gives him the chance to interact with other small business owners in his community. He talks about how his business is the only source of income that his family has. 

Romas has applied for a Kiva loan to purchase more stock such as Fanta, Coca-Cola and Sprite. By purchasing this additional stock it will help with expanding his business and profit. Romas is confident that accessing microfinance will allow him to grow his business and provide a better life for his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as Fanta, Coca-Cola and Sprite for his wholesale business.

loans.name: Sadio

texts.fr:
Madame SADIO née en 1959 à SIBIRASSO, mariée,  mère de 2 enfants, elle réside aec son  époux dans une famille traditionnelle à GNOZEBOUGOU un village de l’arrondissement de LOULOUNI dans la région de Sikasso 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Madame SADIO mène des activités d’achat et de vente des céréales il ya 6 ans, elle s’approvisionne à N’DOLLEN et les village environnants de N’DOLLEN.
A fin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso un neuvième prêt individuel. Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 20 sacs de céréales pour la revendre au détail sur place et au marché à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 52 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sadio was born in 1959 in Sibirasso. She is married, the mother of two children, and resides with her husband in a traditional family in Gnozebougou, a village in the district of Loulouni, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Mrs. Sadio has been trading cereals for the past six years. She gets her supplies from N'Dollen and its surrounding villages.

In order to satisfy the needs of an increasing number of customers, she is requesting a ninth individual loan from the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution. This loan will enable her to buy 20 bags of grain for retail sales on the spot or at the market, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects an average monthly profit of 52,000 CFA francs. This profit will allow her to pay off the loan and its interest, and put the rest into savings.

loans.use: buy cereals

loans.name: Safi

texts.en:
Safi is 39 years old and married. They have been blessed with four children. She has been operating the following businesses: a cyber cafe, MPESA services, poultry keeping as well as rental houses for four years now. Her current monthly income is KES 258,000.

Safi would like a loan of KES 100,000 and has successfully paid all her previous loans, this being her second loan term.

With this loan, Safi will buy more feed for her poultry and a printer for her cyber cafe. She anticipates that through her profits she will add more poultry and expand her cyber cafe with more computers.

In the future she hopes and dreams of becoming a large scale poultry trader in Nairobi County and a renowned business woman generally.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and a printer for her cyber cafe

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc Claire

texts.fr: Jeanne d'arc claire est une dame âgée de 56 ans, mariée et mère de 07 enfants. comme activité, elle dispose d'une vente à emporter dans un quartier de la ville de 07 ans environ. elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des casiers de bières, des casiers de boissons gazeuses et quelques bouteilles de vins rouges pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. les revenus générés lui permettront d'aider son mari à mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille. elle a comme ambitions pour son activité de faire dans la vente en gros des boissons.
texts.en:
Jeanne D'arc Claire is a 56-year-old woman, married, and a mother of seven children. For work, she has run a take-away shop in a local part of town for about seven years. This work goes well for her.

She would like, with this loan, to buy cases of beer, cases of carbonated beverages, and some bottles of red wine to increase her stock in order to satisfy customer demand.

Equally, this increase in stock will increase her turnover. Earnings will allow her to help her husband better support their family's needs. 

In the future, she wants to become a beverage wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase beverages that she will sell in her takeaway shop

loans.name: Madjiguene's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois dont fait partie ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2011.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité le commerce de céréales.

Madjiguéne en position debout qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 23 ans,est mariée et mére de 03 enfants dont 01 garçon.

Son activité est le commerce de céréales mil,maïs,arachide,ainsi avec le crédit reçu,elle compte acheter 200kg de mil à 175f le kg,200kg de maÏs à 100f le kg et le reste de l'arachide.

Elle compte participer aux charges familliales,renforcer son fonds de roulement et augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois, of which this group is a part, was created in July of 2011. The group is made up of members who live in the same town, and they all work selling cereals.

Madjiguéne, who is standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the leader of the group. She is 23 years old, married, and a mother of three children, of whom one is a boy.

Madjiguéne sells cereals such as millet, corn, and groundnuts. And with this loan, she plans to buy 200 kilograms of millet at 175 francs per kilogram, 200 kilograms of corn at 100 francs per kilogram, and the rest on groundnuts.

She plans [to use her earnings] to help take care of her family's expenses, increase her business funds, and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy millet, corn, and groundnuts

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe FAIDA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme LALA debout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes FAIDA, fait la vente de riz. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  4 sacs de 50 kg de riz au grand marché et effectue ses ventes en détail à  Hamdallaye à une clientèle composée d’ hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The four members of the Faida group are married women who on average are 37 years old with five children. Most of them live in traditional families in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, part of the third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their sixth group loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution,  to meet the needs of their customers.
Ms. Lala sells rice. In this photo of the Faida group of women, she is standing in the second position from left to right.

She intends to buy with the loan four 50-kilo bags of rice at the general market, and sell it retail in Hamdallaye to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects average monthly profits of 35,000 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used to pay the loan and its interest, and the rest put into savings.

loans.use: buy rice

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old recently married man from a small village called Qabayta, near Jenin City in Palestine. He works as an employee in a local firm but his low income is not enough to cover all his family's needs. Ali wanted to improve the family income, so he decided to open a small grocery store in the village. It is a good business and demand is high.
Ali has applied for a $1000 (USD) loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more inventory for his grocery store. Using this loan, Ali will be able to improve the store and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for his grocery store

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née en Juin 1976 à Sikasso, Madame Fatoumata  est une femme veuve et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit chez son oncle avec un de ses enfants à Bougoula-Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso troisième région administrative de la république de MALI.
Madame Fatoumata mène des activités d’achat et de vente des condiments il y a  cinq ans au grand marché de Sikasso dont elle dispose une place. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cessait d’accroitre, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux années et avec qui elle est à son cinquième prêt individuel, les 4 prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce cinquième prêt lui permettra d’augmenter son stock de condiments (13 cartons maggi, 10 cartons concentrée de tomate, 12 sacs d’oignons, 15 cartons de moutarde, etc.). 
 Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in June 1976 in Sikasso, Ms. Fatoumata is a widow and the mother of two children. She lives with her uncle and one of her children in Bougoula-Ville, the central town in Sikasso, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

For the past five years Ms. Fatoumata has been trading condiments at the big market of Sikasso where she has a stand. To better satisfy an increasing number of customers, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution about two years ago, and is on her fifth individual loan. All four previous loans have been properly reimbursed.

This fifth loan will enable her to increase her stock of condiments (13 cartons of Maggi cubes, 10 cartons of tomato concentrate, 12 bags of onions, 15 cases of mustard, etc.).

With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 65,000 CFA francs that will be used to contribute towards family expenses, pay interest on the loan and have the the rest reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more "bitter ball" (a vegetable) and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en:
Umeda is a hard-working 36-year-old woman who lives in an agricultural region of Tajikistan. She is married and has three children. She has been busy growing crops and vegetables as her farming business is the only source of income for her family. Her husband helps her with managing the farm. 
Umeda is planning to sow new crops but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Tajikistan Somoni (TJS) to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Maimouna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2011.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité l'agriculture.

Seynabou qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras est la responsable du groupe,elle est responsable du groupe,elle est mariée et mére de 04 enfants.

Son activité est l'agriculture,elle cultive du mil et de l'arachide.

Avec son crédit,elle compte acheter 04 sacs de 50 kg d'arachide à 9000f l'un et 80 kg de mil à 175f le kg.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne,assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2011. It is made up of members who live in the same town. They all work in agriculture.

Seynabou, who is on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the leader of the group. She is married and a mother of four children. She works farming millet and groundnuts.

With this loan, she plans to buy four 50-kilogram sacs of groundnuts at 9,000 francs a sac and 80 kilograms of millet at 175 francs a kilogram.

Her goal is to increase her savings and ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to buy millet and groundnuts

loans.name: Jua Group

texts.en:
Rose is aged in her mid thirties and has two sons who are in school. For eight years now, Rose has had a business selling clothes. She opens her shop from 7:30am to 6:30pm each working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy fashionable clothes to resell. Rose dreams of building a nice house for her family. She will share this loan with her loan group "JUA", which has five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy fashionable clothes to resell.

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.en: Fazilat is married and has two children. She is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life for her children. When they were little, she began her own animal husbandry business, which mainly involves feeding cows. She has requested a loan of 5000 Tajikistan somonis (TJS) to increase the number of animals she has for sale. Fazilat hopes for the support of Kiva lenders with this loan as she will use it to improve her family's income.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Shoghakat

texts.en:
Shoghakat lives in Yeghnik village, Armenia, with her husband and younger son. Her elder son is currently a migrant worker in a neighboring country who supports his family financially. 
Shoghakat herself is involved in farming. In particular, she keeps livestock (cows, sheep, calves and chickens) as well as cultivates wheat and grass as forage for the livestock. Income from this farming is very important for her family so Shoghakat would like to increase it. 
She has requested this loan of $1500 (USD) to purchase ten more sheep, barley and fertilizer for her farm. Shoghakat will be very grateful to lenders if they support her business.

loans.use: to pay for 10 sheep, barley and fertilizer

loans.name: Heghush

texts.en:
Heghush lives with her husband, her mother-in-law and her two sons. The village where they live is located in the Shirak region. Locals there are mostly involved in cattle breeding. Heghush and her family members are also farmers.
They keep three cows, chickens and eight calves. Heghush also cultivates forage as food for the livestock. Unfortunately the land that she owns is very small and the forage isn't enough for feeding all of the livestock.
Heghush is asking for this loan of USD 1500 to be able to purchase 10 piglets and forage for feeding the livestock. Heghush and her family will be very grateful if lenders help them with their farm.

loans.use: to pay for 10 piglets and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
This is Matluba, age 47, a resident of Tajikistan. She is divorced and has three children whom she supports. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Matluba manages a business selling clothes. She buys women's clothes from the central market and sells them to people in her region. Every season she tries to renew her assortment and in this way she attracts more customers. She is asking for a loan of 2000 USD to buy women's clothes for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Irakora I Group

texts.fr:
Anastasie fait partie du groupe  Irakora I et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 54 ans et est mariée à Joseph, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants  âgés de  9 à 22 ans   dont 6 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de tuyaux, des fils électriques,... depuis 1 an. 

Elle est à  son dixième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de tuyaux et de fils électriques à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Anastasie is a member of the Irakora I group and lives in Gitega. She is 54 years old and is married to a Joseph, a merchant. Together they have eight children, aged nine to 22 years old. Six of the children go to school.

Anastasie has been selling pipes and electrical wiring for one year. 

She is on her tenth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital to buy many pipes and electrical wiring to resell and earn more.

loans.use: to buy pipes and electrical wiring to resell

loans.name: Wariti Group

texts.fr: La cliente Lubira est une commerçante depuis 16 ans, présidente et membré de la banque communautaire «Wariti», entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 58 ans, veuve et mère de 8 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des  poissons salés. Elle étale sa marchandise dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 2 sacs de poissons. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de sa famille. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, construire une maison,  scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien, qu’elle apporte aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancable.
texts.en:
Lubira has been a merchant for 16 years and is a member and the president of the Wariti group. She is a dynamic entrepreneur, 58 years old, a widow, and a mother of eight children, who all go to school. Lubira sells salted fish. She started this business with funds from her family. She displays her goods in a central town market. 

She is seeking a loan though Hekima in order to increase her business. [With this loan] she is going to buy two sacs of fish.

In the future, Lubira wishes to increase her capital, build a house, and feed and school her children.

She thanks Hekima for their support of female entrepreneurs who lack access to banking services.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish for her business

loans.name: Dieu Est Bon Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZOENABO représente le groupe DIEU EST BON. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 11ans. Tous vont à l’école.
Mme vend de combustible et du savon depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02 rangées de combustible.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut épargner pour de nouvelles activités. Mme ambitionne  agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins  de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Zoenabo is the representative of the Dieu Est Bon group. She is doing well. Married, she is a mother of five children. The eldest is 30 years old and the youngest is 11 years old. All go to school.

Zoenabo has been selling fuel and soap for [more than] seven years. She procures her goods from a local market. 

[With this loan] she plans to buy two loads of fuel. With her earnings, she wants to save for new business activities.

Zoenabo hopes to expand her business and support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy two loads of fuel

loans.name: Santos Maritza

texts.es:
En una comunidad en Estelí, está ubicada desde hace 6 años la pequeña tienda de calzado de doña Santos. Madre soltera, comerciante, emprendedora y luchadora, ya que al momento de separarse de su esposo, ella decidió seguir adelante con el negocio, solo con el apoyo de su hijo.
Pares de zapatos tras pares de zapatos, están lineados los productos de diferentes tonalidades que doña Santos ofrece a su clientela, además de una pequeña cantidad de bolsos que ha ido agregando a su inventario. Actualmente sueña con dar a conocer su producto a los pueblos cercanos, asimismo permitirles a sus clientes llevarles a sus casas el producto que deseen. Para esto sabe que necesita reinvertir en el negocio, comprar más calzado, tanto de hombres como para mujeres y niños, bolsos de todos los estilos y por último, entrar de lleno en la compra y venta de cosméticos. Y así tener un futuro próspero donde pueda incrementar sus ingresos, para poder cumplir su meta de ahorrar cierta cantidad mensual, ya sea por cualquier emergencia o para establecer en un futuro, otras tiendas por todo Estelí.
texts.en:
For 6 years, Doña Santos has had a small shoe store in a community in Estelí. She is a single mother, shopkeeper, entrepreneur and a fighter: when she separated from her husband, she decided to go ahead with the business with only the support of her son.

Shoes are lined up, pair after pair, products of different shades which Doña Santos offers her clients, along with a small number of bags which she has been adding to her inventory. Currently she dreams of introducing her product to the nearby villages and also allowing her customers to take home the product they want. 

To do this she knows that she needs to reinvest in the business, buy more shoes (for men, women and children) and bags of all styles and, finally, to enter fully into buying and selling cosmetics. Thus she can have a prosperous future where she can increase her income to meet her goal of saving a certain monthly amount, either for emergencies or to establish other shops around Estelí in the future
.

loans.use: to buy more shoes (for men, women and children), bags of all styles and, finally, to enter fully into buying and selling cosmetics

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdou, âgé de 61 ans est enseignant de profession, qui exerce depuis 1977. Il est marié et père de 6 enfants dont 3 garçons et 3 filles. L’ainé, une fille est née en 1981 et la benjamine, en 1999.
Il y a deux ans de cela, Abdou achète quelques kilogrammes de mil et de maïs pour essayer un commerce de céréales locales, l’opération a réussi. Voulant renouveler l’expérience en augmentant la quantité, il vient solliciter un crédit de 500 000F auprès de l’IMCEC. Actuellement, il a aménagé un espace chez lui, afin d’acheter et de stocker les produits qu’il gardera d’ici 5 à 6 mois, pour pouvoir le revendre à un prix beaucoup plus intéressant.
Pour préparer sa retraite, Abdou initie déjà ses enfants dans cette activité et paie une formation en gestion à l’un d’eux qui pourra faire les comptes. Le projet d’Abdou est d’ouvrir une entreprise familiale de commerce et de transport.
texts.en:
Abdou, who is 61 years old, is a teacher by trade and has been teaching since 1977. He is married and father to six children, three boys and three girls. The eldest, who is a daughter, was born in 1981 and the youngest in 1999. 

Two years ago Abdou bought several kilos of millet and corn to set up a small business selling local cereals, and this activity has been successful. As he would like to renew this experience by increasing the quantity of cereals, he has just requested a loan of 500,000 francs from IMCEC. At present he has organised some space in his home so that he can buy and stock the products which he will keep for five to six months and then resell them at a more interesting price. In preparation for his retirement, Abdou is already introducing his children to this activity and is paying for one of them to do a management course so that he can do the accounts. Abdou's plan is to set up a family trading and transport company.

loans.use: to buy cereals, millet and corn for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
Tursunoy is from Tajikistan.  It’s a country where one can disconnect from the noise and appreciate the beauty of nature as the scenery is very beautiful. She loves her country very much.  She is widowed and has 3 children. To make a living, she sells food items. She has been engaged in her business for 13 years and earns some money for these activities. Tursunoy works every day for around 10 hours each day. She thinks her activity is going well because she is very kind and she loves what she does.
She is requesting a loan of 7500 somoni which will be used to buy more food items to sell.
She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy food items to sell

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is 35 years old and married with one 7-year-old son. His son is attending first grade.  He and his family live in the small town of Mpika, Zambia where he operates a Zoona mobile money transfer outlet.  
 
Allan is requesting his second Kiva loan.  The first loan was used to help increase his working capital in order to service more customers and earn additional profit.  With the second loan, Allan plans to continue his business's growth by purchasing a new trading booth and increasing his cash and electronic funds. He explains how having enough funds in the business is important to serve all the customers at his shop who need to send and receive money.  Right now, he is unable to serve all his customers as efficiently as he would like because of capital constraints.

Allan explains how the growth from his first Kiva loan has improved his family's quality of life with the extra income he now earns. His son’s school fees are paid on time and he is able to provide better for his family's basic needs. He would like to thank the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to grow his mobile money business to service more customers in his community who need financial services.

loans.name: El Amana Group

texts.en:
Najla, the featured borrower from the El Amana group, is standing at the far right side of this picture. She is a 47-year-old married mother of two children. She puts so much effort into developing her business to provide them with the necessities of life. She is also a good supporter to her husband. 

Seven months ago, Najla established a convenience store, where she sells food products, home goods and special tasty espresso coffee, which is highly recommended in her region.

She got together with the other group members to hold each others hands and support each other through the loan process because they have always been special neighbours and friends. They acquired the loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. 

Najla's loan will be invested in special-offer spring and summer beverages to develop her business and increase her capital. As for the other group members, Fayza is the first from the left, in the blue top, and Riman is in the center of the picture.

loans.use: To buy special-offer spring and summer beverages to develop her business and increase her capital.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales como becerros y toretes desde hace 03 años aproximadamente, también vende leche de 03 vacas de su propiedad por la zona y alrededores, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de dos vacas lecheras para ofrecer a la venta leche fresca a sus vecinos y moradores de su distrito.
texts.en:
Elvira is a 41-year-old rancher from Chiclayo Province in the Lambayeque Region in northern Peru. Elvira and her children live in the coastal town of Lagunas, where many people earn their living as farmers, ranchers, or shopkeepers. 

Elvira has for approximately three years bought and sold calves and young bulls. Her herd also includes three dairy cows, and she sells their milk in Lagunas and nearby towns. Elvira is applying for a loan of 3,000 new soles to purchase two dairy cows so that she can sell fresh milk to her neighbors and the residents of Lagunas.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows so she can sell fresh milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel de 43 años de edad vive con su esposa, el tiene un negocio de venta de tortas y hamburguesas desde hace 4 años tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de su residencia con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar,  Miguel solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus tortas y hamburguesas como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, entre otros ingredientes y así poder tener mejores ganancias y tener junto con su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel, 43 years old, lives with his wife. He has had a business selling sandwiches and hamburgers for four years. He has a good customer base because he sells his food at a good price. His business is located close to where he lives, and he covers some household expenses with his earnings. 

Miguel is requesting a loan to allow him to buy all that he needs in order to make sandwiches and hamburgers, such as bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, meat, and other ingredients. In this way he will be able to make better earnings and provide his wife and himself with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pruchase bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, meat, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Varsik

texts.en:
Varsik is from Bazmaberd village in Armenia. She lives there with her husband and two children (a 15 year-old-son and a 22 year-old daughter). 

Varsik is a farmer. Her farm includes cows, calves and chickens. She also owns a plot of land where she cultivates grass as forage for the livestock. 

Unfortunately, the land is very small, and the forage isn't enough to feed all the cattle. That's the reason Varsik has applied for this loan of $1,400 (US). 

This loan will greatly help her to purchase forage for the livestock. Please help this hardworking woman to continue her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase five cubic feet of sand, stones and 20 pieces of roofing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bread, butter, eggs, milk and other food supplies in bulk to sell at a profit to her customers.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionicia de 60 años de edad, habita en casa de un familiar con su esposo. Dionicia tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas razón por la cual ya es muy conocida en la zona y los clientes la prefieren por brindar un buen servicio y sobre todo higiene y buenos precios en sus tortillas. Ella es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora cada día se pregunta cómo puede mejorar sus ingresos para poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para poder comprar maíz por quintales y cal para seguir elaborando las tortillas  y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Dionicia, 60 years old, lives in a family home with her spouse. She has spent many years selling tortillas, and as such she is very well known in her area. Her customers prefer her tortillas because she offers good service and, above all, a clean space and good prices for her tortillas. She is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman. Every day she asks herself how she can increase her earnings in order to give her family a better quality of life. She decided to request this loan in order to buy corn in 100kg measures (quintals) and lime in order to continue making tortillas and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn in 100kg measures (quintals) and lime.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is 51 years old. She is widowed and has a daughter. 

Mahbuba has had her own business for more than 18 years. She sells women's clothes and shoes in a local market, where she has her own selling place. 

She is a very hardworking woman and tries to develop business and to have a wide assortment of stock. Mahbuba is helped by her daughter with managing the business. She is going to buy women's clothes and shoes for the new season but she has not the money. 

Mahbuba is asking for a loan of 5000 Tajikistan somoni (TJS) to buy women's clothes and shoes. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes and shoes for the new season

loans.name: Jose Edgardo

texts.es: José tiene 39 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus cuatro hijos de 17 años, 16 años, 12 años y 4 años de edad. José trabaja en un vivero cercano a su localidad y  su compañera de vida se dedica a la comercialización de hortalizas desde hace mucho tiempo. José desea reparar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de dos docenas de lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar lo antes posible las paredes y techo de la vivienda que se encuentran deterioradas.
texts.en:
Jose is 39 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and their three children of 17, 16, 12 and 4 years old. Jose works in a nursery near where he lives, and his partner has worked in vegetable sales for quite some time.

Jose wants to repair the state of their dwelling, so he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy two dozen sheets of galvanized steel and wood to repair the walls and roof as soon as possible. The walls and roof of the dwelling are deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy galvanized steel and wood to repair the walls and roof of his dwelling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Maria Transito

texts.es: Maria de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, ella es una mujer luchadora y responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años,  tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio el plato de comida,  Maria desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, más materia prima como: pollos, carnes, arroz, frutas, verduras, etc.  para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su hijo lo necesario sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Maria, 56 years old, lives in her own home with her spouse and their children. She is a hardworking and responsible woman, and as such her family has all that it needs to get by. She has been working for a number of years selling food near her home. She has many regular customers as she sells meals at a good price. 

Maria would like to expand her food stall, by purchasing tables, chairs, and other materials like chicken, meat, rice, fruit, vegetables, etc., so that she can vary her menu and increase her earnings a bit. However, she doesn't have the necessary funds to make this investment. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy the items, so that she can increase her earnings and give her son all that he needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and basic materials like chicken, meat, rice, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin and his wife have been married for nine years and have two children; the elder of them is 7 years old and is going to the first class of school this year, and the other child is going to kindergarden and she is 5 years old. Ramin’s wife is a housewife and therefore all the needs of the family are provided by Ramin.

Ramin is a master: he sticks wallpaper, makes putty, plaster, etc. Over the 9 years he has been in this business, the quality of his work is good, therefore Ramin has a lot of customers.

Today he wants to support his business, so Ramin has applied for a loan in amount of 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy construction materials which will be useful in his work. He says he is thankful to the Kiva organization and all lenders for help. In the future he wants to hire an assistant to increase his business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrian de 57 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 15 años, tiene mucha clientela fija que lo buscan por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, comercializa en los alrededores de la comunidad de donde el reside, gracias a sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, adrian está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de los insumos necesarios como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, etc. y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Adrian, 57 years of age, has worked growing corn for fifteen years. He has many long-term clients who seek him out for the quality of his product and his good prices. He sells in the area around the community where he lives. Thanks to his sales, he is able to cover the expenses that arise in his household. He lives in his own home with his wife and son.

Adrian is requesting a loan to buy necessary supplies such as fertilizers, composts, pest control, herbicides, seeds, etc., so that, together with his family, he can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, composts, pest control, herbicides, seeds, etc

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 26 años de edad posee desde hace varios años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia donde comercializa granos básicos, refrescos, huevos, azúcar, sopas, golosinas, dulces, etc. tiene clientela ya establecida por la variedad de sus productos y los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y así poder tener mejores ganancias para tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The borrower, 26 years old, has had a small store for several years. It is located in her place of residence, where she sells staple foods, soft drinks, eggs, soups, candy, sweets, etc. She has an established clientele due to the variety of her products and her good prices. With the sales she makes, she is able to cover the expenses of her household. She lives in her own house with her husband and daughter.

The borrower is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to stock her store, so she can make better profits to have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy staple foods, soft drinks, eggs, sugar, soups, candies, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Mushkiniso

texts.en: Mushkiniso is a very hardworking and responsible woman. She is married and has 2 adult-aged children. She lives with her family in the capital of Tajikistan. Mushkiniso began her business, cooking and selling flatbreads, 24 years ago. She has a workshop where she cooks flatbreads and then sells them on a street. Mushkiniso's daughter helps her to manage the business. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy flour and butter to increase working capital. Mushkiniso awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy flour and butter

loans.name: Aregnaz

texts.en:
Aregnaz lives in the village of Tsater with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two little grandchildren. Aregnaz and her family have  been running a farm for 10 years. Near the house where they live, the family keeps livestock of sheep, cows, piglets, chickens and calves. They also cultivate wheat and potatoes and the gathered harvest is sold in the local open market.

The family is hardworking so they perfectly manage to sustain their living. Aregnaz has now applied for this loan of USD 2,000 to be able to pay for workers for organizing the land cultivation process and to purchase fertilizer and forage for the livestock. Aregnaz will be very grateful to lenders for the loan.

loans.use: to pay for workers for land cultivation and to purchase fertilizer and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more butter for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice by the bag, oil, pepper, Vita, fish, meat, etc., for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile phone top up credit and other provisions to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ghenwa Group

texts.en:
Amal is the featured borrower of Ghenwa group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Amal is the second lady from the left.  She is a 51-year-old married mother of four children who has been working in renting and selling special occasion dresses at her house since eight years ago. Amal is a good support to her family. Her acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business capital with a special newly-released collection that she is going to buy from Turkey upon customer requests to make sure the newly-released items will fulfill customers' needs.

As for the other group members, Ghinwa is the first lady standing at the far left side of the picture, while Johaina is the first from the right.

loans.use: to increase her business capital with a special newly-released collection

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulk supplies for her store to sell at a profit to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fashion blouses, jeans, t-shirts, etc., to expand her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly, 45 years old, is married to Bartolomeus, 47 years old. They have been blessed with 4 children: George, 20, a worker; Alan, 16, senior high school; Javier, 11, elementary school; Queny, 4, early childhood education.

Melly is a housewife who has been running a chicken breeding business for 7 years. She used her own capital to establish the business to generate more income. Unfortunately, over the last year, the business suffered a loss as all of the chicks died of disease. However, the business income was spent to finance Melly's mother's medical treatment costs.  

Now, Melly wants to recommit the business, but she does not have enough cash to do so. She has applied for an individual loan from TLM of IDR 3,000,000. The loan will be used to purchase 2 boxes of chicks and a feeder. Melly is expecting that the business will run well, so it will enable her to repay the loan and have a better business income.

loans.use: to purchase 2 boxes of chicks and a feeder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wigs and other artificial hair for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more creams, waxes, oils and other hair products for her to use in her work and to sell to customers

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Al entrar a la pulpería de don Julio, se siente una mezcla de olores conocidos en nuestro día a día, ya que este comerciante le ofrecer a los estilianos todos los productos de la canasta básica. Ese aroma a leche en polvo, la perfumada esencia del desodorante, el fuerte olor a detergente, pero principalmente el señor de los señores en Nicaragua, el café recién hecho por don Julio para empezar su día laboral con el pie derecho, recorren sutilmente por toda la pulpería. 
Julio inició con un pequeño capital de la familia, luego comenzó a invertir poco a poco en mercadería y canastos para ubicar sus productos. Afortunadamente, tiene la dicha de que su familia lo apoya al cien por ciento. Ahora le gustaría dar a conocer sus productos a barrios cercanos. Para esto sabe que necesita el préstamo para incrementar su mercadería, comprar más azúcar, arroz, frijoles, leche, café, entre otros víveres de mayor demanda que le permitan crecer. Ya que su sueño principal es convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora mayoritaria.
texts.en:
Upon entering Julio's grocery store, you experience a mixture of familiar scents from our day-to-day life, since this retailer offers the people of Esteli all the products that go in a 'basic food basket.' That smell of powdered milk, the perfumed essence of deodorant, the strong scent of detergent... but above all the lord of lords in Nicaragua, coffee made fresh by Julio to start his workday off on the right foot, wafts subtly through the entire grocery.

Julio began with a bit of capital from his family, and then he began to invest little by little in merchandise and baskets to put his products in. Luckily, he has the good fortune of being supported 100% by his family. Now he would like to make his products known to local neighborhoods. To do this, he knows he needs the loan to increase his merchandise, buying more sugar, rice, beans, milk, coffee and other supplies in high demand which will allow his business to grow. His most important dream is to turn his small grocery into a wholesale distributor.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, beans, milk, coffee and other provisions

loans.name: Jouhaina

texts.en:
Jouhaina is a 31-year-old married mother of two children who has been working selling children's clothes and shoes for the past ten years. At the beginning, she was an employee in a clothing shop, but she developed herself quickly to become the owner of the same shop after one year. In 2010, she established her own business to help and support her beloved husband in earning their living.

Jouhaina is acquiring her second loan cycle from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business merchandise with newly-released special spring and summer collections. Jouhaina is well known in her region with special talents in her domain and impressive customer service. She works hard and wishes to expand her business and diversify her products in the near future to improve her family's socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with newly-released special spring and summer collections

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
La venta de tortillas, crema  y hielo,  fue la primera forma de iniciarse en el mundo del  comercio de  María. Al pasar los años, opto por otra alternativa que le generara más ingresos y abrió una licorería en su hogar.  Los ahorros, de los dos negocios anteriores, los utilizó para establecer una pequeña pulpería y para la compra de algunos electrodomésticos. Su hija y esposo le brindan todo el apoyo necesario. Una parte del salario que su marido obtiene como albañil es usado para los gastos del hogar. 
La meta de María  es contar con un espacio en el mercado y aumentar la cantidad de comestibles que ofrece actualmente,  por eso  solicitó un crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, huevos, azúcar, productos que cuentan con  mucha demanda entre sus clientes.  Los ingresos serán destinados para  mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar. Para María, los fondos KIVA son un apoyo esencial para los pequeños comerciantes como ella.
texts.en:
María's first business was selling tortillas, dairy products, and frozen snacks. After a few years, she decided to start another business in order to boost her income and opened a liquor store in her home. María used the savings from these two businesses to set up a shop where she sells groceries and small household appliances. María's husband and her daughter provide whatever help she needs to run the store. María's husband also contributes his earnings from construction work to meet the family's household expenses.    

María's goal is to find a space for her shop in the local market and offer a greater inventory of products. She has therefore applied for a loan to purchase rice, cooking oil, eggs, and sugar, the goods with the highest demand among her customers. María will use the income from her store to make improvements to her home. María feels that funds from Kiva loans are an essential source of support for small business owners like her.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, eggs, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food supplies to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, charcoal, pepper and oil to resell.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose de 45 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la siembra de maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, de esa manera es como el puede llevar el sustento a su hogar y solventar los gastos que se le presentan, vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, semillas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde desea realizar la siembra para poder cosechar mejores cultivos y poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Jose is 45 years old. He has worked for several years growing corn. He sells his product in the different markets close to his residence. This is how he is able to support his home and pay for any expenses. He lives with his family in their own home. Jose is asking for a loan to buy agricultural materials he needs, such as: fertilizer, pest control, seeds, herbicides, etc. as well as improve the land where he plants his crops. This will make his get better harvests and obtain better profits to give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pest control, seeds, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Maria Carmelina
